The Joint Implementation Committee of the\nEPA shall be chaired in turn for one (1) year by a representative of one or\nother of the Parties. It shall submit an annual report to the Joint Council of\nthe West Africa - European Union EPA.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint Implementation\nCommittee of the EPA shall perform the following functions in particular;\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the area of trade:\ni)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 ensure the implementation and correct\napplication of the provisions of the Agreement and examine and recommend\ncooperation priorities in this regard;\nii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 supervise the further elaboration of\nthe provisions of this Agreement and evaluate the results obtained in its\napplication;;\niii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 take action to avoid disputes and to\nresolve disputes that may arise regarding the interpretation or application of\nthe Agreement, in accordance with the provisions of Part IV;\n(iv)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 assist the Joint Council of the West Africa - European Union EPA in the performance of its functions;\n(v)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 monitor the development of regional\nintegration and economic and trade relations between the Parties;\nvi)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 monitor and assess the impact of the\nimplementation of this Agreement on the sustainable development of the Parties;\n(vii)\u00a0\u00a0 discuss and take action that may\nfacilitate trade, investment and business opportunities between the Parties;\n(viii)\u00a0 discuss any matters relating to this\nAgreement and any issue liable to affect the attainment of its objectives; \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 in the area of development:\ni)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 assist the Joint Council of the West Africa \u2013 European Union EPA in the performance of its functions regarding development\ncooperation matters falling under this Agreement;\nii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 monitor the implementation of the\ncooperation provisions laid down in this Agreement and coordinate such action\nwith third party donors;\niii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 make recommendations on trade-related\ncooperation between the Parties;\n(iv)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 keep under periodic review the\ncooperation priorities set out in this Agreement, and to make recommendations\non the inclusion of new priorities, as appropriate;\n(v)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 review and discuss cooperation issues\npertaining to regional integration and implementation of this Agreement.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the performance of its\nfunctions, the Joint Implementation Committee of the EPA may: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 set up and supervise special\ncommittees or bodies to deal with matters falling within its competence, and\ndetermine their composition and duties, and their rules of procedure;\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 consider any issues arising from this\nAgreement and take appropriate action in the performance of its functions;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 take decisions or make recommendations\nin the cases provided for in this Agreement or where such implementing power\nhas been delegated to it by the Joint Council of the West Africa - European\nUnion EPA. In such cases, the Joint Implementation Committee of the EPA shall\ntake decisions and make recommendations by mutual agreement between the\nParties. \n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint Implementation\nCommittee of the EPA shall meet once a year to generally examine the\nimplementation of this Agreement at a date and with an agenda agreed in advance\nby the Parties, in each of the regions in turn. The Joint Implementation\nCommittee of the EPA may, if necessary, meet in extraordinary sessions to\nperform the functions provided for in paragraph 3(a) and (b).\nArticle 96 \nJoint West Africa - European Union Parliamentary Committee \n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint West Africa - European Union Parliamentary Committee shall provide a framework for\nconsultation and dialogue between Members of the European Parliament and\nMembers of the Parliaments of ECOWAS and the UEMOA. It shall meet at intervals\nthat it shall itself determine. It shall cooperate with the Joint Parliamentary\nAssembly referred to in Article 17 of the Cotonou Agreement.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint West Africa -\nEuropean Union Parliamentary Committee shall be composed, on the one hand, of\nMembers of the European Parliament and, on the other hand, by Members of the\nregional Parliaments of West Africa. The representatives of the Parties may\nattend meetings of the Joint West Africa - European Union Parliamentary\nCommittee.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint West Africa -\nEuropean Union Parliamentary Committee shall adopt its rules of procedure and\ninform the Joint Council of the EPA West Africa \u2013 European Union of this.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint West Africa -\nEuropean Union Parliamentary Committee shall be chaired in turn by a Member of\nthe European Parliament and by a Member of the Parliaments of ECOWAS and the\nUEMOA in accordance with the conditions laid down by its rules of procedure.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint West Africa -\nEuropean Union Parliamentary Committee may request the Joint Council of the\nWest Africa \u2013 European Union EPA to supply it with any useful information\nconcerning the implementation of this Agreement and the Joint Council of the\nWest Africa \u2013 European Union EPA shall supply it with the requested\ninformation.\n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint West Africa -\nEuropean Union Parliamentary Committee shall be kept informed of the decisions\nand recommendations of the Joint Council of the West Africa \u2013 European Union\nEPA .\n7.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint West Africa -\nEuropean Union Parliamentary Committee may make recommendations for the\nattention of the Joint Council of the West Africa \u2013 European Union EPA and the\nJoint Implementation Committee of the EPA.\nArticle 97 \nJoint West Africa-European Union Consultative Committee\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint West\nAfrica-European Union Consultative Committee is responsible for helping the\nJoint Council of the West Africa \u2013 European Union EPA promote dialogue and\ncooperation between the economic and social partners of the two Parties. Such\ndialogue and cooperation shall encompass all economic, social and environmental\naspects of relations between the Parties as they arise in the context of the\nimplementation of this Agreement.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint Council of the West Africa \u2013 European Union EPA shall determine participation in the Joint West\nAfrica-European Union Consultative Committee, while ensuring wide\nrepresentation of all the interested parties. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint West\nAfrica-European Union Consultative Committee shall perform its activities in\nconsultation with the Joint Council of the West Africa \u2013 European Union EPA or\non its own initiative and make recommendations for the attention of the Joint\nCouncil of the West Africa \u2013 European Union EPA . Representatives of the\nParties shall attend the meetings of the Joint Consultative Committee. \n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint West\nAfrica-European Union Consultative Committee shall adopt its rules of procedure\nin agreement with the Joint Council of the West Africa \u2013 European Union EPA. It\nshall meet at intervals that it shall itself determine.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint West\nAfrica-European Union Consultative Committee may submit recommendations to the\nJoint Council of the West Africa \u2013 European Union EPA and the Joint\nImplementation Committee of the EPA.\nArticle 98 \nFinancing\nthe operation of the institutional architecture \nThe Parties agree to cooperate with a view\nto financing the bodies provided for in Article 91 in accordance with the\nprovisions contained in Part III of this Agreement. The financing terms and\nconditions shall be laid down by the rules of procedure of these bodies in\nagreement with the Joint Council of the EPA.\nPART\nVII\nFINAL\nPROVISIONS\nArticle 99 \nDefinition\nof the Parties and fulfilment of obligations\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Parties to this\nAgreement are the European Union Party and the West Africa Party.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The European Union Party\ncomprises the European Union and its Member States or the European Union or its\n  Member States within their respective areas of competence as derived from the\nTreaty on European Union and the Treaty on the Functioning of the European\nUnion.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The West Africa Party\ncomprises the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS), the West\nAfrican Economic and Monetary Union (UEMOA) and their Member States within their respective areas of competence as derived from the ECOWAS and UEMOA\nTreaties and Mauritania.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Parties shall take any\ngeneral or specific measures necessary for them to fulfil their obligations and\nshall ensure that they comply with the objectives laid down in this Agreement.\nArticle 100 \nContact\npoints and exchange of information\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In order to facilitate\ncommunication and ensure the effective implementation of this Agreement, the\nParties shall each designate a contact point upon this Agreement's entry into\nforce. The designation of contact points shall be without prejudice to the\nspecific designation of competent authorities under specific provisions of this\nAgreement.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 At the request of either\nParty, the contact point of the other Party shall indicate the office or\nofficial responsible for any matter pertaining to the implementation of the\nAgreement and provide the support necessary to facilitate communication with\nthe requesting Party.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 At the request of either\nParty, and to the extent legally possible, each Party through its contact point\nshall provide information and reply promptly to any question from the other\nParty relating to an actual or proposed measure that might affect trade between\nthe Parties.\nArticle 101 \nTransparency\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Parties shall ensure\nthat any laws, regulations, procedures and administrative rulings of general\napplication as well as any international commitments relating to any trade\nmatter covered by this Agreement are promptly published or made publicly\navailable and brought to the attention of the other Party.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Without prejudice to\nspecific transparency provisions in this Agreement, the information referred to\nunder this Article shall be considered to have been provided when the\ninformation has been communicated by appropriate notification to the WTO or\nwhen the information has been distributed on the official, public and fee-free\nwebsite of the Party concerned.\nArticle 102 \nConfidentiality\nNothing in this\nAgreement shall require either Party to provide confidential information, the\ndisclosure of which would impede law enforcement or otherwise be contrary to\nthe public interest or that would prejudice legitimate commercial interests of\nparticular enterprises, public or private, except where its disclosure is\nnecessary in connection with a dispute settlement proceeding under Part IV of\nthis Agreement. Where such disclosure is considered necessary by a panel\nestablished under Article 68, the panel shall ensure that confidentiality is\nfully protected.\nArticle 103 \nRegional\npreference\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Nothing in this Agreement\nshall oblige a Party to extend to the other Party of this Agreement any more\nfavourable treatment than is applied within each of the Parties as part of its\nrespective regional integration process. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If more favourable\ntreatment or any benefit is granted to the European Union or one of its Member\nStates by a West African State or its economic communities under this Agreement\nor vice versa, each signatory to this Agreement shall also immediately and\nunconditionally benefit from it. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The provisions of this\nAgreement cannot be interpreted as meaning that the European Union or the West\nAfrica Party are obliged to mutually grant one another preferential treatment\nthat would be applicable owing to the European Union or the Economic Community\nof West African States and Mauritania being party to a regional economic\nintegration agreement at the time of entry into force of this Agreement.\nArticle 104 \nOutermost regions of the European Union\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Taking account of the\ngeographical proximity of the outermost regions of the European Union and the\nWest Africa Party, and in order to strengthen economic and social links between\nthese regions and the West Africa Party, the Parties shall endeavour to\nfacilitate cooperation in all the areas covered by this Agreement and\nfacilitate trade in goods and services, promote investments and encourage\ntransport and communication links between the outermost regions and the West\nAfrica Party.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The objectives enunciated\nin paragraph 1 shall be pursued, wherever possible, while encouraging the joint\nparticipation of the West African States and the outermost regions in framework\nand specific programmes of the European Union in areas covered by this\nAgreement. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The European Union Party\nshall endeavour to ensure coordination between the different financial\ninstruments of the European Union's cohesion and development policies in order\nto promote cooperation between the West Africa Party and the outermost regions\nof the European Union in the areas covered by this Agreement.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Nothing in this Agreement\nshall prevent the European Union Party from applying existing measures aimed at\naddressing the structural social and economic situation of the outermost\nregions pursuant to Article 349 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the\nEuropean Union.\nArticle 105 \nRelationships with other agreements\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Nothing in this Agreement\nmay be interpreted as preventing the taking by the European Union Party or any\nof the West African States of any measure deemed appropriate concerning this\nAgreement in accordance with the relevant provisions of the Cotonou Agreement. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Parties agree that\nnothing in this Agreement requires them to act in a manner inconsistent with\ntheir obligations in connection with the WTO.\nArticle 106\nRendez-vous clause\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Parties agree to\ncontinue negotiations in order to arrive at a full regional Agreement.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Without prejudice to the\nfollowing topics and without prejudging the results of these negotiations, the\nParties mutually undertake to enter into discussions concerning:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 services;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 intellectual property and innovation,\nincluding traditional knowledge and genetic resources;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 current payments and capital movements;\n\nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 protection of personal data;\ne)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 investment; \nf)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 competition; \ng)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 consumer protection; \nh)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sustainable development; \ni)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 public contracts.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purposes referred\nto in paragraph 1 of this Article, within six (6) months of the conclusion of\nthis Agreement, the Parties shall reach agreement on a roadmap setting out the\nschedule and arrangements for these negotiations. \nArticle 107\nRatification and entry into force\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 This Agreement shall be\nratified or approved by the signatory Parties in accordance with their respective\nconstitutional rules and procedures. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 This Agreement shall enter\ninto force on the first day of the first month following the date on which are\nlodged the ratification instruments of all the Member States of the European\nUnion and at least two thirds of the States of the West African region and the\ninstrument of approval of this Agreement by the European Union.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Pending the entry into\nforce of the Agreement, West Africa and the European Union shall agree, by\nnotification, to provisionally apply the Agreement, in whole or in part.\nProvisional application shall be notified to the depositary. The Agreement\nshall apply on a provisional basis one (1) month after receipt of the final\nnotice of provisional application.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If, pending the entry into\nforce of the Agreement, the Parties decide to apply it provisionally, all\nreferences to the date of entry into force shall be deemed to refer to the date\nsuch provisional application takes effect.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Notwithstanding paragraph\n3, West Africa and the European Union may take measures to apply the Agreement,\nin whole or in part, before provisional application, to the extent feasible.\nArticle 108 \nDepositories\nThe instruments\nof ratification or approval shall be lodged, in the case of the European Union\nParty and its Member States, with the General Secretariat of the Council of the\nEuropean Union and, in the case of the West African States, with the Commission\nof the Economic Community of West African States. The ECOWAS Commission and the\nGeneral Secretariat of the Council of the European Union shall immediately\ninform the signatory Parties of this.\nArticle 109\nDuration\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 This Agreement shall be\nvalid indefinitely.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Either Party may give\nwritten notice to the other of its intention to terminate the Agreement.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Termination shall take\neffect six (6) months after notification to the other Party.\nArticle 110\nTerritorial\napplication\nThis Agreement\nshall apply, on the one hand, to the territories in which the Treaty\nestablishing the European Union is applied and under the conditions laid down\nin that Treaty, and, on the other hand, to the West African States. References\nin the Agreement to \"territory\" shall be understood in this sense.\nArticle 111 \nRevision\nclause\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Parties agree, as\nappropriate and in accordance with the provisions of Article 92, to assess or\nreview this Agreement every five (5) years from the date of entry into force. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Twelve (12) months before\nthe end of each five-year period at the latest, the Parties shall inform one\nanother of the provisions of the Agreement that they wish to review with a view\nto eventual amendment. Ten (10) months before the end of the current five-year\nperiod, the Parties shall enter into negotiations in order to discuss any\namendments to be made to the Agreement. It shall be reviewed in the light of\nthe experience acquired by the Parties during its implementation.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Notwithstanding this\ntiming, the Parties may consider reviewing this Agreement as required, in\nparticular on expiry of the Cotonou Agreement. \n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If one Party requests the\nreview of any provisions of the Agreement, the other Party shall have a period\nof two (2) months in which to request the extension of the review to include\nother provisions related to those that were the subject of the initial request.\nArticle 112 \nAccession of new Member States to the European Union\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Joint Council of the\nWest Africa-European Union EPA shall be advised of any request made by a third\nState to become a member of the European Union. During the negotiations between\nthe European Union and the applicant State, the European Union Party shall\nprovide the West Africa Party with any relevant information and the West Africa\nParty shall convey in turn its concerns to the European Union Party so that it\ncan take them fully into account. Any accession to the European Union shall be\nreported by the European Union Party to the West Africa Party.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Any new Member State of the European Union shall become Party to this Agreement from the date of its\naccession by means of a clause to that effect in the act of accession. If the\nact of accession to the European Union does not provide for such automatic\naccession of the EU Member State to this Agreement, the EU Member State\nconcerned shall accede to it by lodging an act of accession with the General\nSecretariat of the Council of the European Union, which shall send a certified\ncopy of it to the West Africa Party.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Parties shall review\nthe effects of the accession of new EU Member States on this Agreement. The\nJoint Council of the West Africa - European Union EPA may decide on any\nadjustment or transitional measures that may be necessary.\nArticle 113 \nAuthentic Texts\nThis Agreement\nis drawn up in duplicate in the Bulgarian, Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch,\nEnglish, Estonian, Finnish, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Italian, Latvian,\nLithuanian, Maltese, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Slovakian, Slovenian,\nSpanish and Swedish languages, all texts being equally authentic.\nArticle 114\nAnnexes\nThe Annexes, Protocols\nand Declarations shall form an integral part of this Agreement.\nSIGNATURES OF THE PARTIES\nLIST OF ANNEXES\n Annex A:  || Protocol defining the concept of \" originating products \" and methods of administrative cooperation \n Annex B: || Customs duties on products originating in West Africa \n Annex C: || Customs duties on products originating in the European Union \n Annex D: || Appendices to Chapter 3 concerning technical barriers to trade, sanitary and phytosanitary measures \n Annex E: || Protocol on mutual administrative assistance in customs matters \n Annex F: || Protocol on the EPA Development Programme (PAPED) \n[1]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purposes of this Article, agricultural\nproducts shall be those covered by Annex I to the WTO Agreement on Agriculture.\n[2]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Not including financing provided by the individual\nMember States.\nANNEX A (Part 1)\nProtocol defining the concept of 'originating products' and the\nmethods of administrative cooperation\n CONTENTS || 25. Submission of proof of origin \n   || 26. Importation by instalments \n   || 27. Exemptions from proof of origin \n TITLE I: General provisions || 28. Information procedure for cumulation purposes \n   || 29. Supporting documents \n Articles || 30. Preservation of proof of origin and supporting documents \n 1. Definitions || 31. Discrepancies and formal errors \n   || 32. General conditions || 33. Administrative conditions for products to benefit from the Agreement \n 3. Wholly obtained products || 34. Notification of customs authorities \n 4. Working or processing of materials whose import into the European Union is free of duty || 37. Verification of suppliers\u2019 declarations \n 7. Cumulation of origin || 38. Dispute settlement \n 8. Principle of territoriality ||   \n 15. Direct transport || Articles \n 16. Exhibitions || 44. Revision and application of rules of origin \n   || 45. Annexes \n TITLE IV: Proof of origin || 46. Implementation of the Protocol \n   || 47. Transitional provision for goods in transit or storage \n Articles ||   \n 17. General conditions 18. Procedure for the issue of a movement certificate EUR.1 ||   \n 19. Movement certificates EUR.1 issued retrospectively 20. Issue of a duplicate movement certificate EUR.1 ||   \n 21. Issue of movement certificates EUR.1 on the basis of a proof of origin issued or made out previously ||   \n 22. Conditions for making out an invoice declaration ||   \n 23. Approved exporter ||   \n 24. Validity of proof of origin ||   \n CONTENTS \n ANNEXES \n ANNEX I: Introductory notes to the list in Annex II \n ANNEX II: List of working or processing required to be carried out on non-originating materials in order for the product manufactured to obtain originating status \n ANNEX II(a): Derogations from the list of working or processing required to be carried out on non-originating materials in order that the product manufactured can obtain originating status \n ANNEX III: Form for movement certificate \n ANNEX IV: Invoice declaration \n ANNEX V A: Supplier's declaration for products having preferential origin status \n ANNEX V B: Supplier's declaration for products not having preferential origin status \n ANNEX VI: Information document \n ANNEX VII: Form for application for a derogation \n ANNEX VIII: Overseas Countries and Territories \n ANNEX IX: Products referred to in Article 7(4) \n JOINT DECLARATION concerning the Principality of Andorra \n JOINT DECLARATION concerning the Republic of San Marino \nTITLE I\nGENERAL PROVISIONS\nArticle 1 \nDefinitions\nFor the purpose of this Protocol, \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018manufacture\u2019 means any kind of\nworking or processing including assembly or specific operations; \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018material\u2019 means any ingredient,\nraw material, component or part, etc., used in the manufacture of the product; \nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018product\u2019 means the product being\nmanufactured, even if it is intended for later use in another manufacturing\noperation; \nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018goods\u2019 means both materials and\nproducts; \ne)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018customs value\u2019 means the value\nas determined in accordance with the 1994 Agreement on implementation of\nArticle VII of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (WTO Agreement on\ncustoms valuation); \nf)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 'ex-works price' means the price\npaid for the product ex works to the manufacturer in the European Union or West\nAfrica in whose undertaking the last working or processing is carried out,\nprovided the price includes the value of all the materials used, minus any\ninternal taxes paid which are, or may be, repaid when the product obtained is\nexported; \ng)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 'value of materials' means the\ncustoms value at the time of importation of the non-originating materials used,\nor, if this is not known and cannot be ascertained, the first ascertainable\nprice paid for the materials in the European Union or West Africa; \nh)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018value of originating materials\u2019\nmeans the value of such materials as defined in (g) applied mutatis mutandis;\n\ni)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 'added value' means the ex-works\nprice minus the customs value of third country materials imported into the\nEuropean Union, the ACP States which have at least provisionally applied an EPA\nor the Overseas Countries and Territories; if the customs value is not known or\ncannot be ascertained, the first ascertainable price paid for the materials in\nthe European Union or West Africa is taken into account;\nj)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018chapters\u2019 and \u2018headings\u2019 mean\nthe chapters and the headings (four-digit codes) used in the nomenclature which\nmakes up the Harmonised Commodity Description and Coding System, referred to in\nthis Protocol as \u2018the Harmonised System\u2019 or \u2018HS\u2019; \nk)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018classified\u2019 refers to the\nclassification of a product or material under a particular heading; \nl)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018consignment\u2019 means products\nwhich are either sent simultaneously from one exporter to one consignee or\ncovered by a single transport document covering their shipment from the\nexporter to the consignee or, in the absence of such a document, by a single\ninvoice; \nm)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 'territories' means territories,\nincluding territorial waters;\nn)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 'OCTs' means the Overseas\nCountries and Territories as defined in Annex VIII.\nTITLE II\nDEFINITION OF THE CONCEPT OF\n\u2018ORIGINATING PRODUCTS\u2019\nArticle 2\nGeneral conditions\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purposes of the\nEconomic Partnership Agreement between West Africa and the European Union,\nreferred to hereafter in this Protocol as 'Agreement', the territories of the West\nAfrican States shall be considered as one territory, hereafter referred to as 'West Africa'.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purposes of the\nAgreement the following products shall be considered as originating in the\nEuropean Union: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products wholly obtained in the European\nUnion within the meaning of Article 3 of this Protocol; \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products obtained in the European\nUnion incorporating materials which have not been wholly obtained there,\nprovided that such materials have undergone sufficient working or processing in\nthe European Union within the meaning of Article 4. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purposes of the\nAgreement the following products shall be considered as originating in West Africa: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products wholly obtained in West Africa within the meaning of Article 3 of this Protocol; \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products obtained in West Africa\nincorporating materials which have not been wholly obtained there, provided\nthat such materials have undergone sufficient working or processing in West\nAfrica within the meaning of Article 4. \nArticle 3\nWholly obtained products\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The following shall be\nconsidered as wholly obtained in the West African region or the European Union:\n\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 live animals born and raised there;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 mineral products extracted from their\nsoil or from their seabed or ocean floor; \nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 vegetable products harvested there;\nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products from live animals raised\nthere; \ne)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 i)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products obtained by\nhunting or fishing conducted there; \nii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products of aquaculture, including\nmariculture, where the animals are raised there from eggs, spawning, larvae or\nfry;\nf)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products of sea fishing and other\nproducts taken from the sea outside the territorial waters of the European\nUnion or of a West African State by their vessels; \ng)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products made aboard their factory\nships exclusively from products referred to in (f) above; \nh)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 used articles fit only for the\nrecovery of raw materials;\ni)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 waste and scrap resulting from\nmanufacturing operations conducted there; \nj)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products extracted from marine soil\nor subsoil outside their territorial waters provided that they have sole rights\nto work that soil or subsoil;\nk)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 goods produced exclusively from the\nproducts specified in (a) to (j). \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The terms \u2018their vessels\u2019\nand \u2018their factory ships\u2019 in paragraph 1(f) and (g) shall apply only\nto vessels and factory ships: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 which are registered or recorded in a\nMember State of the European Union or a West African State; and\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 which fly the flag of a Member State\nof the European Union or a West African State; and\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 which meet one of the following\nconditions:\ni)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 they are at least 50 % owned by nationals\nof the Member States of the European Union or of the West African States;\nor\nii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 they are owned by companies:\n\u2013              \nwhich have their head office and their main\nplace of business in a Member State of the European Union or a West African\nState; and\n\u2013              \nwhich are at least 50 % owned by one or\nmore Member States of the European Union or one or more West African States or\nby public entities or nationals of one or more of these States; and\nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 whose crew meets the conditions laid\ndown in paragraph 3.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purposes of\nArticle 3(2)(d), at least 10 % of the crew shall be citizens of West Africa or the European Union. This percentage shall be reviewed by the Special\nCommittee on Customs and Trade Facilitation every three (3) years or at the\nrequest of the European Union or West Africa, account being taken of the\navailability of qualified citizens of West Africa. \n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Notwithstanding the\nprovisions of paragraph 2, upon request of a State or a group of States of\nWest Africa, vessels chartered or leased by this State or these States shall be\ntreated as 'their vessels' to undertake fisheries activities in its exclusive\neconomic zone provided that an offer has been made beforehand to the economic\noperators of the European Union and that the implementing arrangements established\nbeforehand by the Special Committee on Customs and Trade Facilitation are\nadhered to. The Special Committee on Customs and Trade Facilitation shall\nensure that the conditions laid down in this paragraph are respected. \n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The conditions referred to\nin paragraph 2 may be met in various States of West Africa and the States that\ncome under various economic partnership agreements with which cumulation is\napplicable. In these cases, the products shall be considered to originate from\nthe Flag State. \nArticle 4\nSufficiently worked or processed\nproducts\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purposes of\nArticle 2, products which are not wholly obtained are considered to be\nsufficiently worked or processed when the conditions set out in the list in\nAnnex II are fulfilled. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purposes of\nArticle 2 and notwithstanding paragraph 1, the products which are listed\nin Annex II(a) can be considered to be sufficiently worked or processed when\nthe conditions set out in that Annex are fulfilled. For a period of five (5)\nyears from the date when the Agreement enters into force, Annex II(a) shall\napply only to exports from West Africa, without prejudice to the provisions of\nArticle 44(2).\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The conditions referred to\nin paragraphs 1 and 2 indicate, for all products covered by this Agreement, the\nworking or processing which must be carried out on non-originating materials\nused in manufacturing and apply only in relation to such materials. It follows\nthat if a product which has acquired originating status by fulfilling the\nconditions set out in one of the lists is used in the manufacture of another\nproduct, the conditions applicable to the product in which it is incorporated\ndo not apply to it, and no account shall be taken of the non-originating\nmaterials which may have been used in its manufacture. \n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Notwithstanding paragraphs\n1 and 2, non-originating materials which, in accordance with the conditions set\nout in Annex II and Annex II(a) should not be used in the manufacture\nof a given product may nevertheless be used, provided that: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 their total value does not exceed 10\nper cent of the ex-works price of the product for products from the European\nUnion, and 15 per cent of the ex-works price of the product for products from West Africa;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 none of the percentages given in the\nlist for the maximum value of non-originating materials are exceeded through\nthe application of this paragraph.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The provisions of\nparagraph 4 shall not apply to products of Chapters 50 to 63 of the Harmonised\nSystem.\n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Paragraphs 1 to 5\nshall apply subject to the provisions of Article 5.\nArticle 5\nInsufficient working or processing\noperations\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The following operations\nshall be considered as insufficient working or processing to confer the status\nof originating products, whether or not the requirements of Article 4 are\nsatisfied:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 preserving operations to ensure that\nthe products remain in good condition during transport and storage;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 simple operations consisting of the\nremoval of dust, sifting or screening, sorting, classifying, matching\n(including the making-up of sets of articles), washing, cleaning, painting,\npolishing, cutting up;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 removal of oxide, oil, paint or other\ncoverings;\nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 i)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 changes of packaging\nand breaking up and assembly of packages;\nii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Simple placing in bottles, flasks,\ncans, bags, cases, boxes, fixing on cards or boards, etc., and all other\nsimple packaging operations;\ne)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 affixing marks, labels, logos and\nother like distinguishing signs on products or their packaging;\nf)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 simple mixing of products, whether or\nnot of different kinds; mixing of sugar with any material;\ng)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 simple assembly of parts to constitute\na complete product; \nh)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 simple disassembly of products into\nparts;\ni)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 ironing or pressing of textiles;\nj)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 husking, partial or total bleaching,\npolishing, and glazing of cereals and rice;\nk)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 operations to colour or flavour sugar\nor form sugar lumps; partial or total milling of crystal sugar;\nl)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 peeling, stoning and shelling, of\nfruits, nuts and vegetables;\nm)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sharpening, simple grinding or simple\ncutting;\nn)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 a combination of two or more operations\nspecified in subparagraphs (a) to (m);\no)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 slaughter of animals.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 All operations carried out\neither in the European Union or in West Africa on a given product shall be\nconsidered together when determining whether the working or processing\nundergone by that product is to be regarded as insufficient within the meaning\nof paragraph 1.\nArticle 6\nWorking or processing of materials whose\nimport into the European Union is free of duty\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Without prejudice to the\nprovisions of Article 2, non-originating materials which at importation to\nthe European Union are free of customs duties by means of application of\nconventional rates of the most-favoured nation tariff in accordance with its\nCommon Customs Tariff[1]\nshall be considered as materials originating in a West African State when\nincorporated into a product obtained there, provided that they have undergone\nworking or processing there which goes beyond the operations referred to in\nArticle 5(1). \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Movement certificates\nEUR.1 (in Box 7) or invoice declarations issued by application of paragraph 1\nshall bear one of the following entries: \n\u2013              \n'Application of art. 6.1 of Protocol 1 to the\nWA-EU EPA'; \n\u2013              \n'Application de l\u2019art. 6.1 du protocole n\u00b0 1 de l'APE AO-UE'.\n\u2013              \n'Aplica\u00e7\u00e3o do artigo 6.1 do Protocolo 1 do APE\nAO-UE'.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The EU shall notify yearly\nto the Special Committee on Customs and Trade Facilitation the list of\nmaterials to which the provisions of this Article shall apply. After\nnotification, the list shall be published by the European Commission in the Official\nJournal of the European Union (C series) and by the West African\nStates in accordance with their own procedures.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The cumulation provided\nfor in this Article shall not apply to materials which at importation to the\nEuropean Union are subject to antidumping or countervailing duties when\noriginating from a country which is subject to these antidumping or\ncountervailing duties.\nArticle 7\nCumulation of origin\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Without prejudice to the\nprovisions of Article 2, materials originating in one of the Parties, in\nother ACP States which have at least provisionally applied an EPA, in the\nRepublic of South Africa or the OCTs shall be considered as originating in the\nother Party when incorporated into a product obtained there, when the working\nor processing carried out in that Party goes beyond the operations referred to\nin Article 5(1). \nWhere the working or processing carried out in\nthe Party concerned does not go beyond the operations referred to in\nArticle 5(1) the product obtained shall be considered as originating in\nthat Party only where the value added there is greater than the value of the\nmaterials used originating in any of the other countries or territories. If\nthis is not so, the product obtained shall be considered as originating in the\ncountry or territory which accounts for the highest value of originating\nmaterials used in the manufacture of the final product. \nThe origin of materials originating in other\nACP States which have at least provisionally applied an EPA and the OCTs shall\nbe determined in accordance with the rules of origin applicable under the\nEuropean Union's preferential arrangements with those countries and in\naccordance with Article 28.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Without prejudice to the\nprovisions of Article 2, working and processing carried out in one of the\nParties, in other ACP States which have at least provisionally applied an EPA\nor in the OCTs shall be considered as having been carried out in the other\nParty, when the materials undergo subsequent working or processing going beyond\nthat referred to in Article 5(1).\nWhere the working or processing carried out in\none of the Parties does not go beyond the operations referred to in\nArticle 5(1), the product obtained shall be considered as originating in\nthat Party only where the value added there is greater than the value of the\nmaterials used in any one of these countries or territories. If this is not so,\nthe product obtained shall be considered as originating in the country or\nterritory which accounts for the highest value of materials used in the\nmanufacture of the final product. \nThe origin of the final product shall be\ndetermined according to the rules of origin of this Protocol and in accordance\nwith Article 28.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The cumulation provided\nfor in paragraphs 1 and 2 may only be applied with respect to other ACP States\nwhich have at least provisionally applied an EPA and the OCTs if:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 all the countries or territories\ninvolved in the acquisition of the originating status and the Party of\ndestination have entered into an arrangement or agreement on administrative cooperation\nwhich ensures correct implementation of this Article and includes a reference\nto the use of appropriate proofs of origin; \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 West Africa and the European Union\nsupply each other, through the European Commission and the ECOWAS Commission,\nwith the details of the administrative cooperation agreements with the other\ncountries or territories referred to in this Article. The European Commission\nshall publish in the Official Journal of the European Union (C series) and the\nWest African States shall publish according to their own procedures the date on\nwhich the cumulation provided for in this Article may be applied with those\ncountries and territories listed in this Article which have fulfilled the\nnecessary requirements.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The cumulation provided\nfor in this Article may only be applied after 1 October 2015 for the products\nlisted in Annex IX when the materials used in the manufacture of such products\nare originating, or the working or processing is carried out in another ACP State which has at least provisionally applied an EPA.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The cumulation provided\nfor in this Article shall not apply to materials:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 of Harmonised Systems Headings 16.04\nand 16.05 originating in the EPA Pacific States by use of Article 6.6 of Protocol\nII of the Interim Partnership Agreement between the European Community, on the\none part, and the Pacific States, on the other part[2]; \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 of Harmonised System Headings 16.04\nand 16.05 originating in the Pacific States by use of any future provision of a\ncomprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement between the European Union and Pacific ACP   States;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 originating in the Republic of South Africa which may not be imported directly into the EU duty-free and\nquota-free. \n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The EU shall notify yearly\nto the Special Committee on Customs and Trade Facilitation the list of\nmaterials referred to by the provisions of paragraph 5(c) of this Article.\nAfter notification, this list shall be published by the European Commission in\nthe Official Journal of the European Union (C series) and by the\nWest African States in accordance with their own procedures. \nArticle 8\nCumulation with other countries benefiting from duty-free quota-free\naccess to the market of the European Union\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Without prejudice to the\nprovisions of Article 2, materials originating in countries and\nterritories: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 benefiting from the 'Special\narrangement for least developed countries' of the Scheme of Generalised Tariff\nPreferences of the European Union; \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 benefiting from duty-free quota-free\naccess to the market of the European Union under the general provisions of the\nScheme of Generalised Tariff Preferences; \nshall be considered as materials originating in\na West African State when incorporated into a product obtained there. \nIt shall not be necessary for these materials\nto have undergone sufficient working or processing, provided they have\nundergone working or processing going beyond that referred to in\nArticle 5(1). If the product into which these materials have been\nincorporated also includes non-originating materials, it will have to undergo\nsufficient working or processing in accordance with Article 4 to be\nconsidered as originating in West Africa.\n1.2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The origin of the materials\nfrom the other countries or territories concerned shall be established in\naccordance with the rules of origin applicable under the Scheme of Generalised\nTariff Preferences of the European Union and in accordance with the provisions\nof Article 28.\n1.3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The cumulation provided for\nin this paragraph shall not apply to materials:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 which at importation to the European\nUnion are subject to antidumping or countervailing duties when originating from\na country which is subject to these antidumping or countervailing duties;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 which are included in tariff\nsubheadings 3302.10 and 3501.10 of the Harmonised System;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 which are included in tuna products\nclassified under Harmonised System Chapter 3 which are covered by the Scheme of\nGeneralised Tariff Preferences of the European Union; \nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 in respect of which tariff preferences\nare removed (graduation) or suspended (safeguard clause) under the Scheme of\nGeneralised Tariff Preferences of the European Union.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 On the basis of a\nnotification from a West African State, without prejudice to the provisions of\nArticle 2 and in compliance with the provisions of paragraphs 2.1, 2.2 and\n5, materials originating in countries or territories which are covered by\nagreements or arrangements that provide for duty-free quota-free access to the\nmarket of the European Union shall be considered to be materials originating in\na West African State. Such notification shall be sent by the West African State\nto the European Union through the European Commission. Cumulation shall apply\nas long as the conditions for granting such cumulation are met. It shall not be\nnecessary for such materials to have undergone sufficient working or\nprocessing, provided they have undergone working or processing going beyond\nthat referred to in Article 5(1). \n2.1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The origin of the materials\nof the countries or territories concerned shall be determined in accordance\nwith the rules of origin applicable in the framework of the European Union's\npreferential agreements or arrangements with those countries and territories\nand in accordance with Article 28.\n2.2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The cumulation provided for\nin this paragraph shall not apply to materials:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 falling within Harmonised System\nChapters 1 to 24 and the products listed in Annex 1 - paragraph 1.(ii) of the\nAgreement on Agriculture belonging to the GATT (WTO) Agreement of 1994;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 which at importation to the European\nUnion are subject to antidumping or countervailing duties when originating from\na country which is subject to these antidumping or countervailing duties;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 which, under a free trade agreement\nbetween the European Union and a third country, are subject to trade measures\nand safeguard measures or any other measure which prevents such products from\nentering the European Union market on a duty-free and quota-free basis.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The European Union shall\nnotify yearly to the Special Committee on Customs and Trade Facilitation the\nlist of materials and countries to which the provisions of paragraph 1 shall\napply. After notification, the list shall be published by the European\nCommission in the Official Journal of the European Union (C series)\nand by the West African States in accordance with their own procedures. West Africa shall notify yearly to the Special Committee on Customs and Trade Facilitation\nthe materials to which the cumulation provided for in paragraphs 1 and 2 has\nbeen applied.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Movement certificates\nEUR.1 (in Box 7) or invoice declarations issued by application of paragraph 1\nand 2 shall bear one of the following entries: \n\u2013              \n'Application of art. 8.1 or 8.2 of Protocol 1 to\nthe WA-EU EPA'; \n\u2013              \n'Application de l\u2019art. 8.1 ou 8.2 du Protocole n\u00b0 1 de l'APE\nAO-UE';\n\u2013              \n'Aplica\u00e7\u00e3o do artigo 8.1 ou 8.2 do Protocolo do APE\nAO-EU'.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The cumulation provided\nfor in paragraphs 1 and 2 of this Article may only be applied provided that:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 all the countries involved in the\nacquisition of the originating status have entered into an arrangement or\nagreement on administrative cooperation which ensures correct implementation of\nthis Article and includes a reference to the use of appropriate proofs of\norigin; \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the West African State or States\nprovide the European Union, through the European Commission, with details of\nagreements on administrative cooperation with the other countries or\nterritories referred to in this Article. The Commission shall publish in the\nOfficial Journal of the European Union (C series) the date on which the\ncumulation provided for in this Article may be applied with those countries or\nterritories listed in this Article which have fulfilled the necessary\nrequirements.\nArticle 9\nUnit of qualification\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The unit of qualification\nfor the application of the provisions of this Protocol shall be the particular\nproduct which is considered as the basic unit when determining classification\nusing the nomenclature of the Harmonised System. \nThis means that: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 when a product composed of a group or\nassembly of articles is classified under the terms of the Harmonised System in\na single heading, the whole constitutes the unit of qualification; \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 when a consignment consists of a\nnumber of identical products classified under the same heading of the\nHarmonised System, each product must be taken individually when applying the\nprovisions of this Protocol. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where, under General\nRule 5 of the Harmonised System, packaging is included with the product\nfor classification purposes, it shall be included for the purposes of\ndetermining origin. \nArticle 10\nAccessories, spare parts and tools\nAccessories, spare parts and tools dispatched with a piece of\nequipment, machine, apparatus or vehicle, which are part of the normal\nequipment and included in the price thereof or which are not separately invoiced,\nshall be regarded as one with the piece of equipment, machine, apparatus or\nvehicle in question. \nArticle 11\nSets of assorted articles\nSets, as defined in General Rule 3 of the Harmonised System,\nshall be regarded as originating when all component products are originating.\nNevertheless, when a set is composed of originating and non-originating\nproducts, the set as a whole shall be regarded as originating, provided that\nthe value of the non-originating products does not exceed 15 percent of the ex-works\nprice of the set. \nArticle 12\nNeutral elements\nIn order to determine whether a product is an originating product,\nit shall not be necessary to determine the origin of the following which might\nbe used in its manufacture: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 energy and fuel; \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 plant and equipment; \nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 machines and tools; \nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 goods which neither enter into\nthe final composition of the product nor are intended to do so. \nArticle 13\nAccounting\nsegregation\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where considerable cost or\nmaterial difficulties arise in keeping separate stocks of originating and\nnon-originating fungible materials, the customs authorities may, at the written\nrequest of those concerned, authorise the so-called \u2018accounting segregation\u2019\nmethod (hereinafter referred to as the method) to be used for managing such stocks.\n\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The method referred to in\nparagraph 1 shall also apply to originating and non-originating raw sugar not\ncontaining added flavouring or colouring matter and intended for refining of\nsubheadings 1701.12, 1701.13 and 1701.14 of the Harmonised System, which is\nphysically combined or mixed in a West African State or the European Union\nbefore being exported to the European Union and to West African States\nrespectively.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The method shall ensure\nthat, at any time, the number of products obtained which could be considered to\noriginate in West African States or the European Union is the same as would\nhave been obtained if the stocks had been physically separated. \n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The customs authorities\nmay make the grant of authorisation referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 subject\nto any conditions deemed appropriate.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The method shall be\napplied and the application thereof shall be recorded on the basis of the\ngeneral accounting principles applicable in the country where the product was\nmanufactured.\n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The beneficiary of the\nmethod may issue or apply for proofs of origin, as the case may be, for the\nquantity of products which may be considered as originating. At the request of\nthe customs authorities, the beneficiary shall provide a statement of how the\nquantities have been managed.\n7.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The customs authorities\nshall monitor the use made of the authorisation and may withdraw it whenever\nthe beneficiary makes improper use of the authorisation in any manner\nwhatsoever or fails to fulfil any of the other conditions laid down in this\nProtocol.\n8.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purposes of\nparagraphs 1 and 2, 'fungible materials' or 'fungible products' shall mean\nmaterials or products which are of the same kind and commercial quality, with\nthe same technical and physical characteristics, and which cannot be\ndistinguished from one another in order to establish their origin.\nTITLE III\nTERRITORIAL REQUIREMENTS \nArticle 14\nPrinciple of territoriality\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Except as provided for in\nArticles 6, 7 and 8 the conditions for acquiring originating status set out in\nTitle II must be fulfilled without interruption in the West African States or\nin the European Union. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Except as provided for in\nArticles 6, 7, and 8 where originating goods exported from West Africa or from\nthe European Union to another country return, they must be considered as\nnon-originating, unless it can be demonstrated to the satisfaction of the\ncustoms authorities that: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the returning goods are the same as\nthose exported; and \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 they have not undergone any operation\nbeyond that necessary to preserve them in good condition while in that country\nor while being exported. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The acquisition of\noriginating status in accordance with the conditions set out in Title II\nshall not be affected by working or processing done outside the European Union\nor West Africa on products exported from the European Union or from West Africa\nand subsequently reimported there, provided:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the said products are wholly obtained\nin the European Union or in West Africa or have undergone working or processing\nthere beyond the operations referred to in Article 5 prior to being\nexported; and\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 it can be demonstrated to the\nsatisfaction of the customs authorities that:\ni)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the working or processing outside the\nEuropean Union or West Africa was done under the outward processing\narrangements, or similar arrangements;\nii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the reimported goods have been\nobtained by working or processing the exported products; and\n(iii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 all costs arising outside West Africa or the European Union, including the value of the materials incorporated there,\ndo not exceed 10 % of the ex-works price of the end product for which\noriginating status is claimed. \n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For goods that meet the\nconditions laid down in paragraph 3, all the costs arising outside West Africa or the European Union, including the value of the materials incorporated there,\nshall be considered to be non-originating materials. In that case the\noriginating status of the goods shall be determined by applying the rules laid\ndown in Annex II, cumulating the total value of the non-originating materials\nused both inside and outside the European Union or West Africa.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The provisions of\nparagraphs 3 and 4 shall not apply to products which can be considered\nsufficiently worked or processed only if the general tolerance fixed in\nArticle 4(4) is applied.\n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The provisions of\nparagraphs 3 and 4 shall not apply to products of Chapters 50 to 63 of the\nHarmonised System.\nArticle 15\nDirect transport\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The preferential treatment\nprovided for under the Agreement applies only to products, satisfying the requirements\nof this Protocol, which are transported directly between West Africa and the\nEuropean Union or through the territories of the other countries referred to in\nArticles 6, 7 and 8 with which cumulation is applicable. However, products\nconstituting one single consignment may be transported through other\nterritories with, should the occasion arise, transhipment or temporary\nwarehousing in such territories, provided that they remain under the\nsurveillance of the customs authorities in the country of transit or\nwarehousing and do not undergo operations other than unloading, reloading or\nany operation designed to preserve them in good condition. \nOriginating products may be transported by\npipeline across territory other than that of West Africa or the European Union.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Evidence that the\nconditions set out in paragraph 1 have been fulfilled shall be supplied to\nthe customs authorities of the importing country by the production of: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 a single transport document covering\nthe passage from the exporting country through the country of transit; or \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 a certificate issued by the customs\nauthorities of the country of transit: \ni)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 giving an exact description of the\nproducts; \nii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 stating the dates of unloading and\nreloading of the products and, where applicable, the names of the ships, or the\nother means of transport used; and \n(iii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 certifying the conditions under which\nthe products remained in the transit country; or \nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 failing these, any substantiating\ndocuments. \nArticle 16\nExhibitions\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Originating products sent\nfor exhibition in a country or territory other than those referred to in\nArticles 6, 7 and 8 with which cumulation is applicable and sold after the\nexhibition for importation into the European Union or West Africa shall benefit\non importation from the provisions of the Agreement provided it is shown to the\nsatisfaction of the customs authorities that: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 an exporter has consigned these\nproducts from West Africa or from the European Union to the country in which\nthe exhibition is held and has exhibited them there; \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the products have been sold or\notherwise disposed of by that exporter to a person in West Africa or in the\nEuropean Union; \nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the products have been consigned\nduring the exhibition or immediately thereafter in the state in which they were\nsent for exhibition; and \nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the products have not, since they were\nconsigned for exhibition, been used for any purpose other than demonstration at\nthe exhibition. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A proof of origin shall be\nissued or made out in accordance with the provisions of Title IV and submitted\nto the customs authorities of the importing country in the normal manner. The\nname and address of the exhibition shall be indicated thereon. Where necessary,\nadditional documentary evidence of the conditions under which they have been exhibited\nmay be required. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Paragraph 1 shall apply to\nany trade, industrial, agricultural or crafts exhibition, fair or similar\npublic show or display which is not organised for private purposes in shops or\nbusiness premises with a view to the sale of foreign products, and during which\nthe products remain under customs control. \nTITLE IV\nPROOF OF ORIGIN\nArticle 17\nGeneral conditions\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Products originating in\nWest Africa shall, on importation into the European Union and products\noriginating in the European Union shall, on importation into West Africa,\nbenefit from the provisions of the Agreement upon submission of either: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 a movement certificate EUR.1, a\nspecimen of which appears in Annex III; or \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 in the cases specified in Article 22(1),\na declaration, subsequently referred to as the 'invoice declaration', given by\nthe exporter on an invoice, a delivery note or any other commercial document\nwhich describes the products concerned in sufficient detail to enable them to\nbe identified; the text of the invoice declaration appears in Annex IV.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Notwithstanding paragraph\n1, originating products within the meaning of this Protocol shall, in the cases\nspecified in Article 27, benefit from this Agreement without it being\nnecessary to submit any of the documents referred to above. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purposes of\napplying the provisions of this title, exporters shall endeavour to use a\nlanguage shared by West Africa and the European Union.\nArticle 18\nProcedure for the issue of a movement\ncertificate EUR.1\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A movement certificate\nEUR.1 shall be issued by the customs authorities of the exporting country on\napplication having been made in writing by the exporter or, under the\nexporter's responsibility, by his authorised representative. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For this purpose, the\nexporter or his authorised representative shall fill out both the movement\ncertificate EUR.1 and the application form, specimens of which appear in Annex\nIII. These forms shall be completed in accordance with the provisions of this\nProtocol. If the forms are handwritten, they shall be completed in ink in\nprinted characters. The description of the products must be given in the box\nreserved for this purpose without leaving any blank lines. Where the box is not\ncompletely filled, a horizontal line shall be drawn below the last line of the\ndescription, the empty space being crossed through. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The exporter applying for\nthe issue of a movement certificate EUR.1 shall be prepared to submit at any\ntime, at the request of the customs authorities of the exporting country where\nthe movement certificate EUR.1 is issued, all appropriate documents proving the\noriginating status of the products concerned as well as the fulfilment of the\nother requirements of this Protocol. \n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A movement certificate\nEUR.1 shall be issued by the customs authorities of a Member State of the\nEuropean Union or a West African State if the products concerned can be\nconsidered as products originating in the European Union, West Africa or one of\nthe other countries or territories referred to in Articles 6, 7 and 8 and\nfulfil the other requirements of this Protocol. \n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The issuing customs\nauthorities shall take any steps necessary to verify the originating status of\nthe products and the fulfilment of the other requirements of this Protocol. For\nthis purpose, they shall have the right to call for any evidence and to carry\nout any inspection of the exporter\u2019s accounts or any other check considered\nappropriate. The issuing customs authorities shall also ensure that the forms\nreferred to in paragraph 2 are duly completed. In particular, they shall check\nwhether the space reserved for the description of the products has been\ncompleted in such a manner as to exclude all possibility of fraudulent\nadditions. \n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The date of issue of the\nmovement certificate EUR.1 shall be indicated in Box 11 of the\ncertificate. \n7.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A movement certificate\nEUR.1 shall be issued by the customs authorities and made available to the\nexporter as soon as actual exportation has been effected or ensured. \nArticle 19\nMovement certificates EUR.1 issued\nretrospectively\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Notwithstanding\nArticle 18(7), a movement certificate EUR.1 may exceptionally be issued\nafter exportation of the products to which it relates if: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 it was not issued at the time of\nexportation because of errors or involuntary omissions or special\ncircumstances; or \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 it is demonstrated to the satisfaction\nof the customs authorities that a movement certificate EUR.1 was issued but was\nnot accepted at importation for technical reasons. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the implementation of\nparagraph 1, the exporter must indicate in his application the place and date\nof exportation of the products to which the movement certificate EUR.1 relates,\nand state the reasons for his request. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The customs authorities\nmay issue a movement certificate EUR.1 retrospectively only after verifying\nthat the information supplied in the exporter's application agrees with that in\nthe corresponding file. \n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Movement certificates\nEUR.1 issued retrospectively must be endorsed with one of the following\nphrases: \n'ISSUED RETROSPECTIVELY'\n'DELIVRE A POSTERIORI'\n'EMITIDO A POSTERIORI'\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The endorsement referred\nto in paragraph 4 shall be inserted in the \u2018Remarks\u2019 box of the movement\ncertificate EUR.1. \nArticle 20\nIssue of a duplicate movement\ncertificate EUR.1\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the event of the\ntheft, loss or destruction of a movement certificate EUR.1, the exporter may\napply to the customs authorities which issued it for a duplicate made out on\nthe basis of the export documents in their possession. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The duplicate issued in\nthis way must be endorsed with one of the following: \n'DUPLICATE'\n'DUPLICATA'\n'SEGUNDA VIA'\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The endorsement referred\nto in paragraph 2 shall be inserted in the \u2018Remarks\u2019 box of the duplicate\nmovement certificate EUR.1. \n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The duplicate, which must\nbear the date of issue of the original movement certificate EUR.1, shall take\neffect as from that date. \nArticle 21\nIssue of movement certificates EUR.1 on\nthe basis of a proof of origin issued or made out previously\nWhen originating products are placed under the control of a customs\noffice in a West African State or in the European Union, it shall be possible\nto replace the original proof of origin by one or more movement certificates\nEUR.1 for the purpose of sending all or some of these products elsewhere within\nWest Africa or within the European Union. The replacement movement\ncertificate(s) EUR.1 shall be issued by the customs office under whose control\nthe products are placed and endorsed by the customs authority under whose\ncontrol the products are placed. \nArticle 22\nConditions for making out an invoice\ndeclaration\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 An invoice declaration as\nreferred to in Article 17(1)(b) may be made out: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 by an approved exporter within the\nmeaning of Article 23; or \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 by any exporter for any consignment\nconsisting of one or more packages containing originating products whose total\nvalue does not exceed EUR 6 000. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 An invoice declaration may\nbe made out if the products concerned can be considered as products originating\nin West Africa, the European Union or in one of the other countries referred to\nin Articles 6, 7 and 8 and fulfil the other requirements of this Protocol. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The exporter making out an\ninvoice declaration shall be prepared to submit at any time, at the request of\nthe customs authorities of the exporting country, all appropriate documents\nproving the originating status of the products concerned as well as the\nfulfilment of the other requirements of this Protocol. \n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 An invoice declaration\nshall be made out by the exporter by typing, stamping or printing on the invoice,\nthe delivery note or another commercial document, the declaration, the text of\nwhich appears in Annex IV to this Protocol, using one of the linguistic\nversions set out in that Annex and in accordance with the provisions of the\ndomestic law of the exporting country. If the declaration is handwritten, it\nshall be written in ink in printed characters. \n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Invoice declarations shall\nbear the original signature of the exporter in manuscript. However, an approved\nexporter within the meaning of Article 23 shall not be required to sign\nsuch declarations provided that he gives the customs authorities of the\nexporting country a written undertaking that he accepts full responsibility for\nany invoice declaration which identifies him as if it had been signed in manuscript\nby him. \n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 An invoice declaration may\nbe made out by the exporter when the products to which it relates are exported,\nor after exportation on condition that it is presented in the importing country\nno longer than two (2) years after the importation of the products to which it\nrelates. \nArticle 23\nApproved exporter\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The customs authorities of\nthe exporting country may authorize any exporter who makes frequent shipments\nof products under the trade cooperation provisions of the Agreement to make out\ninvoice declarations irrespective of the value of the products concerned. An\nexporter seeking such authorisation must offer to the satisfaction of the\ncustoms authorities all guarantees necessary to verify the originating status\nof the products as well as the fulfilment of the other requirements of this\nProtocol. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The customs authorities\nmay grant the status of approved exporter subject to any conditions which they\nconsider appropriate. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The customs authorities\nshall grant to the approved exporter a customs authorisation number which shall\nappear on the invoice declaration. \n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The customs authorities\nshall monitor the use of the authorisation by the approved exporter. \n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The customs authorities\nmay withdraw the authorisation at any time.
