They shall do so where the approved\nexporter no longer offers the guarantees referred to in paragraph 1, no\nlonger fulfils the conditions referred to in paragraph 2 or otherwise\nmakes an incorrect use of the authorisation. \nArticle 24\nValidity of proof of origin\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A proof of origin shall be\nvalid for ten (10) months from the date of issue in the exporting country, and\nmust be submitted within that period to the customs authorities of the\nimporting country. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Proofs of origin which are\nsubmitted to the customs authorities of the importing country after the final\ndate for presentation specified in paragraph 1 may be accepted for the\npurpose of applying preferential treatment, where the failure to submit these\ndocuments by the final date set is due to exceptional circumstances. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In other cases of belated\npresentation, the customs authorities of the importing country may accept the\nproofs of origin where the products have been submitted before the said final\ndate. \nArticle 25\nSubmission of proof of origin\nProofs of origin shall be submitted to the customs authorities of\nthe importing country in accordance with the procedures applicable in that\ncountry. These authorities may require that a proof of origin be translated.\nThey may also require the import declaration to be accompanied by a statement\nfrom the importer to the effect that the products meet the conditions required\nfor the implementation of the Agreement. \nArticle 26\nImportation by instalments\nWhere, at the request of the importer and on the conditions laid\ndown by the customs authorities of the importing country, dismantled or\nnon-assembled products within the meaning of General Rule 2(a) of the\nHarmonised System falling within Sections XVI and XVII or headings 73.08\nand 94.06 of the Harmonised System are imported by instalments, a single\nproof of origin for such products shall be submitted to the customs authorities\nupon importation of the first instalment. \nArticle 27\nExemptions from proof of origin\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Products sent as small\npackages from private persons to private persons or forming part of travellers'\npersonal luggage shall be admitted as originating products without requiring\nthe submission of a proof of origin, provided that such products are not\nimported by way of trade and have been declared as meeting the requirements of\nthis Protocol and where there is no doubt as to the veracity of such a\ndeclaration. In the case of products sent by post, this declaration can be made\non customs declaration CN22/CN23 or on a sheet of paper annexed to that\ndocument. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Imports which are\noccasional and consist solely of products for the personal use of the\nrecipients or travellers or their families shall not be considered as imports\nby way of trade if it is evident from the nature and quantity of the products\nthat no commercial purpose is in view. \n3\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Furthermore, the total\nvalue of these products shall not exceed EUR 500 in the case of small\npackages or EUR 1 200 in the case of products forming part of\ntravellers' personal luggage. \nArticle 28\nInformation procedure for cumulation\npurposes\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 When Article 7(1) is\napplied, the evidence of originating status within the meaning of this\nProtocol, of the materials coming from West Africa, from the European Union,\nfrom another ACP State which has at least provisionally applied an EPA or an\nOCT shall be given by a movement certificate EUR.1 or by the supplier\u2019s\ndeclaration, a specimen of which appears in Annex V A to this Protocol,\ngiven by the exporter in West Africa or in the European Union from which the\nmaterials came. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 When Article 7(2) is\napplied, the evidence of working or processing of the materials coming from\nWest Africa, from the European Union, from another ACP State which has at least\nprovisionally applied an EPA or an OCT shall be given by the supplier\u2019s\ndeclaration, a specimen of which appears in Annex V B to this Protocol,\ngiven by the exporter in West Africa or in the European Union from which the\nmaterials came. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 When Article 8(1) is\napplied, the documentary proofs of origin applicable shall be determined in\naccordance with the rules which apply to GSP countries[3];\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 When Article 8(2) is\napplied, the documentary proofs of origin applicable shall be determined in\naccordance with the rules laid down in the relevant arrangements or agreements.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A separate supplier's\ndeclaration shall be issued by the supplier for each consignment of goods on\nthe commercial invoice relating to that shipment or in an annex to that\ninvoice, or on a delivery note or other commercial document relating to that\nshipment which describes the materials concerned in sufficient detail for them\nto be identified. \n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The supplier\u2019s declaration\nmay be issued on a pre-printed form. \n7.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The supplier\u2019s\ndeclarations shall bear the original signature of the supplier in manuscript.\nHowever, where the invoice and the supplier's declaration are issued using\nelectronic data-processing methods, the supplier's declaration need not be\nsigned in manuscript provided the responsible official in the supplying company\nis identified to the satisfaction of the customs authorities in the State where\nthe supplier's declaration is issued. Those customs authorities may lay down\nconditions for the implementation of this paragraph. \n8.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The supplier\u2019s\ndeclarations shall be submitted to the customs authorities in the exporting country\nrequested to issue the movement certificate EUR.1.\n9.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The supplier issuing a\ndeclaration must be prepared to submit at any time, at the request of the\ncustoms authorities of the country where the declaration is issued, all\nappropriate documents proving that the information given on this declaration is\ncorrect.\n10.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Supplier\u2019s declarations and\ninformation certificates issued before the date of entry into force of this\nProtocol in accordance with Article 26 of Protocol 1 to the Cotonou\nAgreement shall remain valid. \nArticle 29\nSupporting documents\nThe documents referred to in Articles 18(3) and 22(3) used\nfor the purpose of proving that products covered by a movement certificate\nEUR.1 or an invoice declaration can be considered as products originating in\nWest Africa, the European Union or one of the other countries or territories\nreferred to in Articles 6, 7 and 8 and fulfil the other requirements of\nthis Protocol may consist inter alia of the following: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 direct evidence of the processes\ncarried out by the exporter or supplier to obtain the goods concerned,\ncontained for example in his accounts or internal bookkeeping; \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 documents proving the originating\nstatus of materials used, issued or made out in West Africa, the European Union\nor one of the other countries or territories referred to in Articles 6, 7 and 8\nwhere these documents are used in accordance with domestic law; \nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 documents proving the working or\nprocessing of materials in West Africa, in the European Union or in one of the\nother countries or territories referred to in Articles 6, 7 and 8, issued or\nmade out in West Africa, in the European Union or in one of the other countries\nor territories referred to in Articles 6, 7 and 8 where these documents are\nused in accordance with national law; \nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 movement certificates EUR.1 or\ninvoice declarations proving the originating status of materials used, issued\nor made out in West Africa, in the European Union or in one of the other\ncountries or territories referred to in Articles 6, 7 and 8 and in accordance\nwith this Protocol. \nArticle 30\nPreservation of proof of origin and\nsupporting documents\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The exporter applying for\nthe issue of a movement certificate EUR.1 shall keep for at least three (3)\nyears the documents referred to in Article 18(3). \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The exporter making out an\ninvoice declaration shall keep a copy of this invoice declaration as well as\nthe documents referred to in Article 22(3) for at least three (3) years. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The supplier making out a\nsupplier\u2019s declaration shall keep for at least three (3) years copies of the\ndeclaration and of the invoice, delivery notes or other commercial documents to\nwhich this declaration is annexed as well as the documents referred to in\nArticle 28(9).\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The customs authorities of\nthe exporting country issuing a movement certificate EUR.1 shall keep for\nat least three (3) years the application form referred to in\nArticle 18(2). \n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The customs authorities of\nthe importing country shall keep for at least three (3) years the movement\ncertificates EUR.1 and the invoice declarations submitted to them. \nArticle 31\nDiscrepancies and formal errors\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The discovery of slight\ndiscrepancies between the statements made in the proof of origin and those made\nin the documents submitted to the customs office for the purpose of carrying\nout the formalities for importing the products shall not ipso facto render the\nproof of origin null and void if it is duly established that this document does\ncorrespond to the products submitted. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Obvious formal errors such\nas typing errors on a proof of origin should not cause this document to be\nrejected if these errors are not such as to create doubts concerning the\ncorrectness of the statements made in this document. \nArticle 32\nAmounts expressed in euro\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the application of the\nprovisions of Article 22(1)(b) and Article 27(3) in cases where\nproducts are invoiced in a currency other than euro, amounts in the national\ncurrencies of the West African States, the Member States of the European Union\nor of the other countries or territories referred to in Articles 6, 7 and\n8 equivalent to the amounts expressed in euro shall be fixed annually by each\nof the countries concerned.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A consignment shall\nbenefit from the provisions of Article 22(1)(b) or Article 27(3) by\nreference to the currency in which the invoice is drawn up, according to the\namount fixed by the country concerned.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The amounts to be used in\nany given national currency shall be the equivalent in that currency of the\namounts expressed in euro as at the first working day of October each year.\nThese amounts shall be communicated to the European Commission by\n15 October at the latest and shall apply from 1 January the following\nyear. The European Commission shall notify all countries concerned of the\nrelevant amounts.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A country may round up or\ndown the amount resulting from the conversion into its national currency of an\namount expressed in euro. The rounded-off amount may not differ from the amount\nresulting from the conversion by more than 5 per cent. A country may retain unchanged\nits national currency equivalent of an amount expressed in euro if, at the time\nof the annual adjustment provided for in paragraph 3, the conversion of that\namount, prior to any rounding-off, results in an increase of less than 15 per\ncent in the national currency equivalent. The national currency equivalent may\nbe retained unchanged if the conversion would result in a decrease in that\nequivalent value.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The amounts expressed in\neuro shall be reviewed by the Special Committee on Customs and Trade Facilitation\nat the request of the European Union or West Africa. When carrying out that\nreview, the Special Committee on Customs and Trade Facilitation shall consider\nthe desirability of preserving the effects of the limits concerned in real\nterms. For this purpose, it may decide to modify the amounts expressed in euro.\nTITLE V\nADMINISTRATIVE COOPERATION\nArticle 33\nAdministrative\nconditions for products to benefit from the Agreement\nProducts originating within the meaning of\nthis Protocol in West Africa or the European Union shall benefit, at the time\nof the customs import declaration, from the preferences resulting from the\nAgreement only on condition that they were exported on or after the date on\nwhich the exporting country complies with the provisions laid down in Articles\n34, 35 and 46.\nThe parties shall make the notifications\nreferred to in Article 34.\nArticle 34\nNotification\nof customs authorities\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The West African States\nand the Member States of the European Union shall provide each other, through the\nEuropean Commission and the ECOWAS Commission, with the addresses of the\ncustoms authorities responsible for issuing and verifying the movement\ncertificates EUR.1, invoice declarations and supplier's declarations and\nwith specimen impressions of stamps used in their customs offices for the issue\nof these certificates.\nMovement certificates EUR.1 and invoice\ndeclarations or supplier\u2019s declarations shall be accepted for the purpose of\napplying preferential treatment from the date this information is received by\nthe European Commission and the ECOWAS Commission.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The West African States\nand the Member States of the European Union shall inform each other immediately\nwhenever there are any changes to the information referred to in paragraph 1.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The authorities referred\nto in paragraph 1 shall act under the authority of the government of the\ncountry concerned. The authorities in charge of control and verification shall\nbe part of the governmental authorities of the country concerned.\nArticle 35\nOther \u00a0methods\nof administrative co-operation \n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In order to ensure the\nproper application of this Protocol, the European Union, West Africa and the\nother countries referred to in Article 6, 7 and 8 shall check, through the\ncompetent customs administrations, the authenticity of the movement\ncertificates EUR.1, the invoice declarations or the supplier\u2019s declarations and\nthe correctness of the information given in these documents. Moreover, the West African  States and the Member States of the European Union:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 shall provide each other with all\nnecessary administrative cooperation in the event of a request for monitoring\nof the proper management and control of the Protocol in the country concerned,\nincluding visits on the spot;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 shall check, in accordance with\nArticle 36, the originating status of the products and the compliance with\nthe other conditions laid down in this Protocol.\n2\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The authorities consulted\nshall furnish the relevant information concerning the conditions under which\nthe product has been made, indicating especially the conditions in which the\nrules of origin have been respected in West Africa, the European Union and the\nother countries referred to in Articles 6, 7 and 8.\nArticle 36\nVerification of proofs of origin\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Subsequent verifications\nof proofs of origin shall be carried out based on risk analysis and at random\nor whenever the customs authorities of the importing country have reasonable\ndoubts as to the authenticity of such documents, the originating status of the\nproducts concerned or the fulfilment of the other requirements of this\nProtocol. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purposes of\nimplementing the provisions of paragraph 1, the customs authorities of the\nimporting country shall return the movement certificate EUR.1 and the invoice,\nif it has been submitted, the invoice declaration, or a copy of these\ndocuments, to the customs authorities of the exporting country giving, where\nappropriate, the reasons for the request for verification. Any documents and\ninformation obtained suggesting that the information given on the proof of\norigin is incorrect shall be forwarded in support of the request for\nverification. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The verification shall be\ncarried out by the customs authorities of the exporting country. For this\npurpose, they shall have the right to call for any evidence and to carry out\nany inspection of the exporter\u2019s accounts or any other check considered\nappropriate. \n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If the customs authorities\nof the importing country decide to suspend the granting of preferential\ntreatment to the products concerned while awaiting the results of the\nverification, release of the products shall be offered to the importer subject\nto any precautionary measures judged necessary. \n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The customs authorities\nrequesting the verification shall be informed of the results of this verification\nas soon as possible. These results must indicate clearly whether the documents\nare authentic and whether the products concerned can be considered as products\noriginating in West Africa, in the European Union or in one of the other\ncountries referred to in Articles 6, 7 and 8 and fulfil the other requirements\nof this Protocol. \n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If in cases of reasonable\ndoubt there is no reply within 10 months of the date of the verification\nrequest or if the reply does not contain sufficient information to determine the\nauthenticity of the document in question or the real origin of the products,\nthe requesting customs authorities shall, except in exceptional circumstances,\nrefuse entitlement to the preferences. \n7.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The parties shall refer to\nArticle 7 of the Protocol on mutual administrative assistance in customs\nmatters for joint enquiries on proofs of origin. \nArticle 37\nVerification of supplier\u2019s declarations\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Verification of supplier\u2019s\ndeclarations shall be carried out based on risk analysis and at random or whenever\nthe customs authorities of the country where such declarations have been taken\ninto account to issue a movement certificate EUR.1 or to make out an invoice\ndeclaration, have reasonable doubts as to the authenticity of the document or\nthe correctness of the information given in this document. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The customs authorities to\nwhich a supplier\u2019s declaration is submitted may request the customs authorities\nof the State where the declaration was made out to issue an information\ncertificate, a specimen of which appears in Annex VI to this Protocol.\nAlternatively, the certifying authorities to which a supplier\u2019s declaration is\nsubmitted may request the exporter to produce an information certificate issued\nby the customs authorities of the State where the declaration was made. \nA copy of the information certificate shall be\npreserved by the office which has issued it for at least three (3) years. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The customs authorities\nrequesting the verification shall be informed of the results of this\nverification as soon as possible. The results must indicate clearly whether the\ninformation given in the supplier\u2019s declaration is correct and make it possible\nfor them to determine whether and to what extent this supplier\u2019s declaration\ncould be taken into account for issuing a movement certificate EUR.1 or for\nmaking out an invoice declaration. \n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The verification shall be\ncarried out by the customs authorities of the country where the supplier's\ndeclaration was made out. For this purpose, they shall have the right to call\nfor any evidence or to carry out any inspection of the supplier\u2019s accounts or\nany other check which they consider appropriate in order to verify the\ncorrectness of any supplier\u2019s declaration. \n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Any movement certificate\nEUR.1 or invoice declaration issued or made out on the basis of an incorrect\nsupplier's declaration shall be considered null and void. \nArticle 38\nDispute settlement\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where disputes arise in\nrelation to the verification procedures of Articles 36 and 37 which cannot\nbe settled between the customs authorities requesting a verification and the\ncustoms authorities responsible for carrying out this verification or where\nthey raise a question as to the interpretation of this Protocol, they shall be\nsubmitted to the Special Committee on Customs and Trade Facilitation. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In all cases, the\nsettlement of disputes between the importer and the customs authorities of the\nimporting country shall take place under the legislation of that country. \nArticle 39\nPenalties\nPenalties shall be imposed on any person who draws up, or causes to\nbe drawn up, a document which contains incorrect information for the purpose of\nobtaining a preferential treatment for products. \nArticle 40\nFree zones\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 West Africa and the\nEuropean Union shall take all necessary steps to ensure that products traded\nunder cover of a proof of origin or a supplier\u2019s declaration and which in the\ncourse of transport use a free zone situated in their territory, are not\nsubstituted by other goods and do not undergo handling other than normal operations\ndesigned to prevent their deterioration. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 By way of derogation from\nthe provisions contained in paragraph 1, when products originating in West\nAfrica or the European Union are imported into a free zone under cover of a\nproof of origin and undergo treatment or processing, the authorities concerned\nshall issue a new movement certificate EUR.1 at the exporter's request, if the\ntreatment or processing undergone is in conformity with the provisions of this\nProtocol. \nArticle 41\nDerogations\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Derogations from this\nProtocol may be adopted by the Special Committee on Customs and Trade\nFacilitation, referred to hereafter in this Article as 'the Committee', when\nthey are justified by the development of existing industries or the creation of\nnew industries in West Africa. To this end, either before or when a West African State submits the matter to the Committee, it shall notify the European Union and West Africa of its request for a derogation together with the reasons for the request in\naccordance with paragraph 2. The European Union shall respond positively to all\nthe West African requests which are duly justified in conformity with this\nArticle and which cannot cause serious damage to an established industry in the\nEuropean Union.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In order to facilitate the\nexamination by the Committee of requests for derogation, the West African State\nmaking the request shall, by means of the form given in Annex VII to this\nProtocol, furnish in support of its request the fullest possible information\ncovering in particular the points listed below:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 description of the finished product;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 nature and quantity of materials\noriginating in a third country;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 nature and quantity of materials\noriginating in the West African State or the States or territories mentioned in\nArticle 7, or of materials that have been processed there;\nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 manufacturing processes;\ne)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 added value;\nf)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 number of employees in the enterprise\nconcerned;\ng)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 anticipated volume of exports to the\nEuropean Union;\nh)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 other possible sources of supply for\nraw materials;\ni)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 reasons for the duration requested in\nthe light of efforts made to find new sources of supply;\nj)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 other observations.\nThe same rules shall apply to any requests for\nextension.\nThe Committee may modify the form.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The examination of\nrequests shall in particular take into account:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the level of development or the\ngeographical situation of the West African State concerned;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 cases where the application of the\nexisting rules of origin would significantly affect the ability of an existing\nindustry in a West African State to continue its exports to the European Union,\nwith particular reference to cases where this could lead to cessation of its\nactivities;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 specific cases where it can be clearly\ndemonstrated that significant investment in an industry could be deterred by\nthe rules of origin and where a derogation favouring the realisation of an\ninvestment programme would enable these rules to be satisfied by stages.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In every case an\nexamination shall be made to ascertain whether the rules relating to cumulation\nof origin do not provide a solution to the problem.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In addition, when a\nrequest for derogation concerns a least-developed or an island State of West Africa, its examination shall be carried out with a favourable bias having particular\nregard to:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the economic and social impact of the\ndecisions to be taken especially in respect of employment;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the need to apply the derogation for a\nperiod taking into account the particular situation of the West African State\nconcerned and its difficulties.\n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the examination of\nrequests, special account shall be taken, case by case, of the possibility of\nconferring originating status on products which include in their composition\nmaterials originating in neighbouring developing countries, least-developed countries\nor developing countries with which one or more West African States have special\nrelations, provided that administrative co-operation can be established.\n7.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Committee shall take\nsteps necessary to ensure that a decision is reached as soon as possible and in\nany case not later than seventy-five working days after the request is received\nby the European Union Co-chairman of the Committee. If the European Union does\nnot inform the West African States of its position on the request within this\nperiod, the request shall be deemed to have been accepted. \n8.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 a)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Derogations shall\nbe valid for a period, generally of five (5) years, to be determined by the\nCommittee.\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The derogation decision may provide\nfor renewals without a new decision of the Committee being necessary, provided\nthat the West African State submits, three (3) months before the end of each\nperiod, proof that it is still unable to meet the conditions of this Protocol\nwhich have been derogated from.\nIf any objection is made to the extension, the\nCommittee shall examine it as soon as possible and decide whether to prolong\nthe derogation. The Committee shall proceed as provided for in paragraph 7. All\nnecessary measures shall be taken to avoid interruptions in the application of\nthe derogation.\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the periods referred to in\nsubparagraphs (a) and (b), the Committee may review the terms for implementing\nthe derogation should a significant change be found to have taken place in the\nsubstantive factors governing the decision to grant the derogation. On\nconclusion of its review the Committee may decide to amend the terms of its\ndecision as regards the scope of derogation or any other condition previously\nlaid down.\n9.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Notwithstanding paragraphs\n1 to 8, automatic derogations concerning canned tuna and tuna loins of HS 16.04\nshall only be granted within an annual quota of 4 800 tonnes for canned\ntuna and within an annual quota of 1 200 tonnes for tuna loins.\nTITLE VI\nCEUTA AND\n  MELILLA\nArticle 42\nSpecial conditions\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The term 'European Union'\nused in this Protocol does not cover Ceuta and Melilla.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Products originating in a\nWest African State, when imported into Ceuta or Melilla, shall enjoy in all\nrespects the same customs regime as that which is applied to products\noriginating in the customs territory of the European Union under\nProtocol 2 of the Act of Accession of the Kingdom of Spain and the Portuguese Republic to the European Communities. West Africa shall grant to imports of\nproducts covered by this Agreement and originating in Ceuta and Melilla the same customs regime as that which is granted to products imported from and\noriginating in the European Union.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purpose of the\napplication of paragraph 2 concerning products originating in Ceuta and Melilla, this Protocol shall apply mutatis mutandis subject to the special\nconditions set out in Article 43.\nArticle 43\nSpecial conditions\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Providing they have been\ntransported directly in accordance with the provisions of Article 15, the\nfollowing shall be considered as:\n1)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products originating in Ceuta and Melilla:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products wholly obtained in Ceuta and Melilla;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products obtained in Ceuta and Melilla in the manufacture of which products other than those referred to in (a) are used,\nprovided that:\ni)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the said products have undergone\nsufficient working or processing within the meaning of Article 4, or that\nii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 those products originate in West\nAfrica or in the European Union, provided that they have been submitted to\nworking or processing which goes beyond the operations referred to in Article 5;\n2)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products originating in a West African\nState:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products wholly obtained in a West\nAfrican State;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 products obtained in a West African\nState, in the manufacture of which products other than those referred to in (a)\nare used, provided that:\ni)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the said products have undergone\nsufficient working or processing within the meaning of Article 4, or that\nii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 those products originate in Ceuta and Melilla or in the European Union, within the meaning of this Protocol, provided\nthat they have been submitted to working or processing which goes beyond the\noperations referred to in Article 5.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Ceuta and Melilla shall be considered as a single territory.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The exporter or his\nauthorised representative shall enter '....' and 'Ceuta and Melilla' in Box 2 of movement certificates EUR.1 or on invoice declarations. In addition, in the case of\nproducts originating in Ceuta and Melilla, this shall be indicated in Box 4 of movement certificates EUR.1 or on invoice declarations.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Spanish customs\nauthorities shall be responsible for the application of this Protocol in Ceuta and Melilla.\nTITLE VII\nFINAL PROVISIONS\nArticle 44\nRevision and\napplication of rules of origin\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In accordance with the\nprovisions of Article 92 of the Agreement, the Joint Council of the West Africa-European\nUnion EPA may, whenever requested by West Africa or the European Union, examine\nthe application of the provisions of this Protocol and their economic effects\nwith a view to adapting or amending them, as necessary. The Joint Council of\nthe West Africa-European Union EPA shall take account, among other factors, of\nthe impact of technological developments on the rules of origin.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Notwithstanding the\nprovisions of paragraph 1, this Protocol and its annexes shall be reviewed and,\nif appropriate, revised within five (5) years of the date when the Protocol\nenters into force, in accordance with the obligations laid down in\nArticle 6 of the Agreement. This review shall also concern\nAnnex II(a) with a view to establishing whether it should be renewed.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In accordance with\nArticle 45 of the Agreement, the Special Committee on Customs and Trade\nFacilitation shall monitor the implementation and management of the provisions\nof this Protocol and take decisions on the following matters, among others:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 cumulation, under the conditions set\nout in Article 8;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the derogations from the provisions of\nthis Protocol, under the conditions set out in Article 41.\nArticle 45\nAnnexes\nThe Annexes to this Protocol shall form an integral part thereof. \nArticle 46\nImplementation of the Protocol\nThe European Union and West Africa shall each take the measures\nrequired to implement this Protocol, including:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the necessary national and\nregional arrangements required for the implementation and enforcement of the\nrules and procedures laid down in this Protocol, in particular the arrangements\nnecessary for the application of the articles on cumulation;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the creation of the\nadministrative structures and systems required for proper management and\nverification of the origin of products.\nArticle 47\nTransitional provision for goods in\ntransit or storage\nThe provisions of the Agreement may be applied to goods which comply\nwith the provisions of this Protocol and which on the date of entry into force\nof this Protocol are either in transit or are in the European Union or in West\nAfrica in temporary storage in customs warehouses or in free zones, subject to\nthe submission to the customs authorities of the importing country, within ten\n(10) months of the said date, of a movement certificate EUR.1 issued\nretrospectively by the customs authorities of the exporting country together\nwith the documents showing that the goods have been transported directly in\naccordance with Article 15.\n[1]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Cf. Annex I to Council\nRegulation (EEC) No 2658/87 on the tariff and statistical nomenclature and\non the Common Customs Tariff and subsequent amending and corresponding legal\nacts. \n[2]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Council Decision 729/2009/EC of 13 July 2009.\n[3]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 See Commission Regulation (EEC) No 2454/93 of 2\nJuly 1993 laying down provisions for the implementation of Council Regulation\n(EEC) No 2913/92, establishing the Community Customs Code\nANNEX A (Part 2)\nANNEX I\nINTRODUCTORY NOTES TO THE LIST IN ANNEX\nII\nNote 1\nThe list sets out the conditions required\nfor all products to be considered as sufficiently worked or processed within\nthe meaning of Article 4 of the Protocol.\nNote 2\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The first two columns in\nthe list describe the product obtained. The first column gives the heading\nnumber or chapter number used in the Harmonised System and the second column\ngives the description of goods used in that system for that heading or chapter.\nFor each entry in the first two columns, a rule is specified in column 3\nor 4. Where, in some cases, the entry in the first column is preceded by\nan \u2018ex\u2019, this signifies that the rules in column 3 or 4 apply\nonly to the part of that heading described in column 2.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where several heading\nnumbers are grouped together in column 1 or a chapter number is given and\nthe description of products in column 2 is therefore given in general\nterms, the adjacent rules in column 3 or 4 apply to all products which,\nunder the Harmonised System, are classified in headings of the chapter or in\nany of the headings grouped together in column 1.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where there are different\nrules in the list applying to different products within a heading, each indent\ncontains the description of that part of the heading covered by the adjacent\nrules in column 3 or 4.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where, for an entry in the\nfirst two columns, a rule is specified in both columns 3 and 4, the exporter\nmay opt to apply either the rule set out in column 3 or that set out in column\n4. If no origin rule is given in column 4, the rule set out in column 3 has to\nbe applied.\nNote 3\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The provisions of Article\n4 of the Protocol concerning products having acquired originating status which\nare used in the manufacture of other products apply regardless of whether this\nstatus has been acquired inside the factory where these products are used or in\nanother factory in the European Union or in the West African States.\nExample:\nAn engine of heading 8407, for which the rule\nstates that the value of the non-originating materials which may be\nincorporated may not exceed 40 per cent of the ex-works price, is made from\n\u2018other alloy steel roughly shaped by forging\u2019 of heading ex 7224.\nIf this forging has been forged in the European\nUnion from a non-originating ingot, it has already acquired originating status\nby virtue of the rule for heading ex 7224 in the list. The forging\ncan then count as originating in the value calculation for the engine,\nregardless of whether it was produced in the same factory or in another factory\nin the European Union. The value of the non-originating ingot is thus not taken\ninto account when adding up the value of the non-originating materials used.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The rule in the list\nrepresents the minimum amount of working or processing required, and the\ncarrying out of more working or processing also confers originating status;\nconversely, the carrying out of less working or processing cannot confer\noriginating status. Thus, if a rule provides that non-originating material, at\na certain level of manufacture, may be used, the use of such material at an\nearlier stage of manufacture is allowed, and the use of such material at a\nlater stage is not.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Without prejudice to Note\n3.2 where a rule states that \u2018materials of any heading\u2019 may be used, materials\nof the same heading as the product may also be used, subject, however, to any\nspecific limitations which may also be contained in the rule. However, the\nexpression \u2018manufacture from materials of any heading, including other\nmaterials of heading ...\u2019 means that only materials classified in the same\nheading as the product of a description other than that of the product as given\nin column 2 of the list may be used.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 When a rule in the list\nspecifies that a product may be manufactured from more than one material, this\nmeans that one or more materials may be used. It does not require that all be\nused.\nExample:\nThe rule for fabrics of headings 5208\nto 5212 provides that natural fibres may be used and that chemical\nmaterials, among other materials, may also be used. This does not mean that\nboth have to be used; it is possible to use one or the other, or both.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where a rule in the list\nspecifies that a product must be manufactured from a particular material, the\ncondition does not prevent the use of other materials which, because of their\ninherent nature, cannot satisfy the rule. (See also Note 6.3 below in relation\nto textiles).\nExample:\nThe rule for prepared foods of heading 1904,\nwhich specifically excludes the use of cereals and their derivatives, does not\nprevent the use of mineral salts, chemicals and other additives which are not\nproduced from cereals.\nHowever, this does not apply to products which,\nalthough they cannot be manufactured from the particular materials specified in\nthe list, can be produced from a material of the same nature at an earlier\nstage of manufacture.\nExample:\nIn the case of an article of apparel of\nex Chapter 62 made from non-woven materials, if the use of only\nnon-originating yarn is allowed for this class of article, it is not possible\nto start from non-woven cloth \u2013 even if non-woven cloths cannot normally be\nmade from yarn. In such cases, the starting material would normally be at the\nstage before yarn \u2013 that is, the fibre stage.\n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where, in a rule in the\nlist, two percentages are given for the maximum value of non-originating\nmaterials that can be used, then these percentages may not be added together.\nIn other words, the maximum value of all the non-originating materials used may\nnever exceed the higher of the percentages given. Furthermore, the individual\npercentages must not be exceeded, in relation to the particular materials to\nwhich they apply.\nNote 4\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The term \u2018natural fibres\u2019\nis used in the list to refer to fibres other than artificial or synthetic\nfibres. It is restricted to the stages before spinning takes place, including\nwaste, and, unless otherwise specified, includes fibres which have been carded,\ncombed or otherwise processed, but not spun.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The term \u2018natural fibres\u2019\nincludes horsehair of heading 0511, silk of headings 5002\nand 5003, as well as wool fibres and fine or coarse animal hair of\nheadings 5101 to 5105, cotton fibres of headings 5201\nto 5203, and other vegetable fibres of headings 5301 to 5305.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The terms \u2018textile pulp\u2019,\n\u2018chemical materials\u2019 and \u2018paper-making materials\u2019 are used in the list to\ndescribe the materials, not classified in Chapters 50 to 63, which can be used\nto manufacture artificial, synthetic or paper fibres or yarns.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The term \u2018man-made staple\nfibres\u2019 is used in the list to refer to synthetic or artificial filament tow,\nstaple fibres or waste, of headings 5501 to 5507.\nNote 5\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where, for a given product\nin the list, reference is made to this Note, the conditions set out in column 3\nshall not be applied to any basic textile materials used in the manufacture of\nthis product and which, taken together, represent 10 per cent or less of the\ntotal weight of all the basic textile materials used. (See also Notes 5.3 and\n5.4 below.)\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 However, the tolerance\nmentioned in Note 5.1 may be applied only to mixed products which have\nbeen made from two or more basic textile materials.\nThe following are the basic textile materials:\n\u2013              \nsilk,\n\u2013              \nwool,\n\u2013              \ncoarse animal hair,\n\u2013              \nfine animal hair,\n\u2013              \nhorsehair,\n\u2013              \ncotton,\n\u2013              \npaper-making materials and paper,\n\u2013              \nflax,\n\u2013              \ntrue hemp,\n\u2013              \njute and other textile bast fibres,\n\u2013              \nsisal and other textile fibres of the genus\nAgave,\n\u2013              \ncoconut, abaca, ramie and other vegetable\ntextile fibres,\n\u2013              \nsynthetic man-made filaments,\n\u2013              \nartificial man-made filaments,\n\u2013              \ncurrent-conducting filaments,\n\u2013              \nsynthetic man-made staple fibres of\npolypropylene,\n\u2013              \nsynthetic man-made staple fibres of polyester,\n\u2013              \nsynthetic man-made staple fibres of polyamide,\n\u2013              \nsynthetic man-made staple fibres of\npolyacrylonitrile,\n\u2013              \nsynthetic man-made staple fibres of polyimide,\n\u2013              \nsynthetic man-made staple fibres of\npolytetrafluoroethylene,\n\u2013              \nsynthetic man-made staple fibres of\npolyphenylene sulphide,\n\u2013              \nsynthetic man-made staple fibres of polyvinyl\nchloride,\n\u2013              \nother synthetic man-made staple fibres,\n\u2013              \nartificial man-made staple fibres of viscose,\n\u2013              \nother artificial man-made staple fibres,\n\u2013              \nyarn made of polyurethane segmented with\nflexible segments of polyether, whether or not gimped,\n\u2013              \nyarn made of polyurethane segmented with\nflexible segments of polyester, whether or not gimped,\n\u2013              \nproducts of heading 5605 (metallised yarn)\nincorporating strip consisting of a core of aluminium foil or of a core of\nplastic film whether or not coated with aluminium powder, of a width not\nexceeding 5 mm, sandwiched by means of a transparent or coloured adhesive\nbetween two layers of plastic film,\n\u2013              \nother products of heading 5605.\nExample:\nA yarn of heading 5205 made from cotton\nfibres of heading 5203 and synthetic staple fibres of heading 5506 is\na mixed yarn. Therefore, non-originating synthetic staple fibres that do not\nsatisfy the origin rules (which require manufacture from chemical materials or\ntextile pulp) may be used up to a weight of 10 per cent of the yarn.\nExample:\nA woollen fabric of heading 5112 made from\nwoollen yarn of heading 5107 and synthetic yarn of staple fibres of heading\n5509 is a mixed fabric. Therefore, synthetic yarn which does not satisfy the\norigin rules (which require manufacture from chemical materials or textile\npulp), or woollen yarn which does not satisfy the origin rules (which require\nmanufacture from natural fibres, not carded or combed or otherwise prepared for\nspinning) or a combination of the two may be used, provided that their total\nweight does not exceed 10 per cent of the weight of the fabric.\nExample:\nTufted textile fabric of heading 5802 made from\ncotton yarn of heading 5205 and cotton fabric of heading 5210 is only a mixed\nproduct if the cotton fabric is itself a mixed fabric made from yarns\nclassified in two separate headings or if the cotton yarns used are themselves\nmixtures.\nExample:\nIf the tufted textile fabric concerned had been\nmade from cotton yarn of heading 5205 and synthetic fabric of heading 5407,\nthen, obviously, the yarns used are two separate basic textile materials and\nthe tufted textile fabric is, accordingly, a mixed product.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the case of products\nincorporating \u2018yarn made of polyurethane segmented with flexible segments of\npolyether, whether or not gimped\u2019 this tolerance is 20 per cent in respect of\nthe yarn.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the case of products\nincorporating a \u2018strip consisting of a core of aluminium foil or of a core of\nplastic film whether or not coated with aluminium powder, of a width not\nexceeding 5 mm, sandwiched by means of an adhesive between two layers of\nplastic film\u2019, this tolerance is 30 per cent in respect of this strip.\nNote 6\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the case of those\ntextile products which are marked in the list by a footnote referring to this\nIntroductory Note, textile trimmings and accessories which do not satisfy the\nrule set out in the list in column 3 for the made-up products concerned may be used\nprovided that their weight does not exceed 10 per cent of the total weight of\nall the textile materials incorporated.\nTextile trimmings and accessories are those\nclassified in Chapters 50 to 63. Linings and interlinings are not to be\nregarded as trimmings or accessories.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Any non-textile trimmings\nand accessories or other materials used which contain textiles do not have to\nsatisfy the conditions set out in column 3 even though they fall outside the\nscope of Note 3.5.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In accordance with Note\n3.5, any non-originating non-textile trimmings and accessories or other\nproducts which do not contain any textiles may, anyway, be used freely where\nthey cannot be made from the materials listed in column 3.\nFor example,[1]\nif a rule in the list says that for a particular textile item, such as a\nblouse, yarn must be used, this does not prevent the use of metal items, such\nas buttons, because they cannot be made from textile materials.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where a percentage rule\napplies, the value of trimmings and accessories must be taken into account when\ncalculating the value of the non-originating materials incorporated.\nNote 7\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purposes of\nheadings ex 2707, 2713 to 2715, ex 2901, ex 2902 and ex 3403, the \u2018specific\nprocesses\u2019 are the following:\n(a)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 vacuum distillation;\n(b)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 redistillation by a very thorough\nfractionation process ([2]);\n(c)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 cracking;\n(d)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 reforming;\n(e)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 extraction by means of selective\nsolvents;\n(f)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the process comprising all the\nfollowing operations: processing with concentrated sulphuric acid, oleum or\nsulphuric anhydride; neutralisation with alkaline agents; decolourisation and\npurification with naturally active earth, activated earth, activated charcoal\nor bauxite;\n(g)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 polymerisation;\n(h)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 alkylation;\n(i)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 isomerisation.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purposes of\nheadings 2710 to 2712, the \u2018specific processes\u2019 are the following:\n(a)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 vacuum distillation;\n(b)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 redistillation by a very thorough\nfractionation process ([3]);\n(c)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 cracking;\n(d)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 reforming;\n(e)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 extraction by means of selective\nsolvents;\n(f)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the process comprising all the following\noperations: processing with concentrated sulphuric acid, oleum or sulphuric\nanhydride; neutralisation with alkaline agents; decolourisation and\npurification with naturally active earth, activated earth, activated charcoal\nor bauxite;\n(g)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 polymerisation;\n(h)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 alkylation;\n(i)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 isomerisation;\n(j)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 in respect of heavy oils of\nheading ex 2710 only, desulphurisation with hydrogen, resulting in a\nreduction of at least 85 per cent of the sulphur content of the products\nprocessed (ASTM D 1266-59 T method);\n(k)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 in respect of products of\nheading 2710 only, deparaffining by a process other than filtering;\n(l)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 in respect of heavy oils of heading\nex 2710 only, treatment with hydrogen, at a pressure of more than 20 bar and a\ntemperature of more than 250 \u00b0C, with the use of a catalyst, other than to\neffect desulphurisation, when the hydrogen constitutes an active element in a\nchemical reaction. The further treatment with hydrogen of lubricating oils of\nheading ex 2710 (e.g. hydrofinishing or decolourisation), in order, more\nespecially, to improve colour or stability shall not, however, be deemed to be\na specific process;\n(m)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 in respect of fuel oils of\nheading ex 2710 only, atmospheric distillation, on condition that\nless than 30 per cent of these products distils, by volume, including losses,\nat 300 \u00b0C, by the ASTM D 86 method;\n(n)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 in respect of heavy oils other than\ngas oils and fuel oils of heading ex 2710 only, treatment by means of\na high-frequency electrical brush-discharge.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the purposes of\nheadings ex 2707, 2713 to 2715, ex 2901, ex 2902 and\nex 3403, simple operations, such as cleaning, decanting, desalting, water\nseparation, filtering, colouring, marking, obtaining a sulphur content as a\nresult of mixing products with different sulphur contents, or any combination\nof these operations or like operations, do not confer origin.\nANNEX II\nLIST\nOF WORKING OR PROCESSING REQUIRED TO BE CARRIED OUT ON NON-ORIGINATING\nMATERIALS IN ORDER FOR THE PRODUCT MANUFACTURED TO OBTAIN ORIGINATING STATUS\nThe products included in the list may not all be covered by the\nAgreement. It is, therefore, necessary to consult the other parts of the\nAgreement.\n HS heading   (1) || Description of product   (2) || Working or processing carried out on non-originating materials that confers originating status \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026(3)\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.or\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026..(4) \n Chapter 01 || Live animals || All the animals of Chapter 1 used are wholly obtained   ||   \n Chapter 02 || Meat and edible meat offal || Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapters 1 and 2 used are wholly obtained     ||   \n ex Chapter 03 || Fish and crustaceans, molluscs and other aquatic invertebrates   || Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapter 3 used are wholly obtained   ||   \n 0304 || Fish fillets and other fish meat (whether or not minced), fresh, chilled or frozen || Manufacture in which the value of all the materials of Chapter 3 used does not exceed 15 % of the ex-works price of the product ||   \n 0305 || Fish, dried, salted or in brine; smoked fish, whether or not cooked before or during the smoking process; flours, meals and pellets of fish, fit for human consumption || It is, therefore, necessary to consult the other parts of the\nAgreement.\nCommon\nprovisions\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the products described\nin the table below, the following rules may also apply instead of the rules set\nout in Annex II.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The proof of origin issued\nor made out in accordance with this Annex shall include the following statement\nin English, French or Portuguese:\n\u2018Derogation \u2013 Annex II(a) of Protocol \u2026 -\nMaterials of HS heading \u2026 originating from \u2026 used.\u2019\n\u2018D\u00e9rogation - Annexe II (a) du protocole\u2026 - Mati\u00e8res de la\nposition du SH n\u00b0 \u2026 originaires de \u2026 utilis\u00e9es.\u2019\n\u2018Derroga\u00e7\u00e3o - Anexo II (a) do Protocolo... -\nMateriais da posi\u00e7\u00e3o ... do SH origin\u00e1rios de ... usados\u2019.\nThis statement shall be contained in box 7 of\nthe EUR.1 movement certificate referred to in Article 18 of the Protocol, or\nshall be added to the invoice declaration referred to in Article 22 of the\nProtocol.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The\nWest African States and the Member States of the European Union shall, each for\ntheir own part, take the measures necessary in order to implement this Annex.\n HS heading || Description of product || Specific derogation concerning the working or processing carried out on non-originating materials which confers originating status \n Chapter 2 || Meat and edible meat offal || All the meat and edible meat offal is wholly obtained \n Chapter 4 || Dairy produce; birds\u2019 eggs; natural honey; edible products of animal origin, not elsewhere specified or included || Manufacture in which: - all the materials of Chapter 4 used are wholly obtained - the content of materials of Chapter 17 used does not exceed 40 %, by weight, of the final product \n Chapter 6 || Live trees and other plants; bulbs, roots and the like; cut flowers and ornamental foliage || Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapter 6 used are wholly obtained or Manufacture in which the value of all the materials used does not exceed 50 % of the ex-works price of the product   \n 0812 to 0814 || Fruit and nuts, provisionally preserved; fruit, dried, other than that of headings 0801 to 0806; peel of citrus fruits or melons || Manufacture in which the content of materials of Chapter 8 used does not exceed 30 %, by weight, of the final product \n Chapter 9 || Coffee, tea, mat\u00e9 and spices || Manufacture from materials of any heading \n 1101 to 1104   || Products of the milling industry || Manufacture from materials of Chapter 10, except rice of heading 1006 \n \u00a01105 to 1109 || Flour, meal, powder, flakes of potatoes, etc.; starches; inulin; wheat gluten || Manufacture in which the content of non-originating materials does not exceed 20 %, by weight   or   Manufacture from materials of Chapter 10, except materials of heading 1006, in which the materials of heading 0710 and sub-heading 0710.10 are wholly obtained \n Chapter 12 || Oil seeds and oleaginous fruits; miscellaneous grains, seeds and fruit; industrial or medicinal plants; straw and fodder || Manufacture from materials of any heading, except that of the product   \n 1301 || Lac; natural gums, resins, gum-resins and oleoresins (for example, balsams) || Manufacture from materials of any heading   \n 1302 || Vegetable saps and extracts; This form shall be printed in one or more of the languages in which the\nAgreement is drawn up. Certificates shall be made out in one of these languages\nand in accordance with the provisions of the domestic law of the exporting\nState. If the forms are handwritten, they shall be completed in ink in block\nletters.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Each certificate shall\nmeasure 210 x 297 mm; a tolerance of up to plus 8 mm or minus\n5 mm in the length may be allowed. The paper used must be white, sized for\nwriting, not containing mechanical pulp and weighing not less than\n60 g/m\u00b2. It shall have a printed green guilloche pattern background,\nmaking any falsification by mechanical or chemical means apparent to the eye.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The exporting States may\nreserve the right to print the certificates themselves or may have them printed\nby approved printers. In the latter case, each certificate shall include a\nreference to such approval. Each certificate must bear the name and address of\nthe printer or a mark by which the printer can be identified. It shall also\nbear a serial number, either printed or not, by which it can be identified.\nMOVEMENT\nCERTIFICATE\n 1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Exporter (Name, full address, country) || \u00a0\u00a0 EUR.1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 No A\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 000.000 \n   || See notes overleaf before completing this form. \n   || 2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Certificate used in preferential trade between   \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \n 3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Consignee (Name, full address, country) (Optional) || \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 and   \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u00a0 (Insert appropriate countries, groups of countries or territories) \n   || 4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Country, group of countries or territory in which the products are considered as originating     || 5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Country, group of countries or territory of destination       \n 6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Transport details (Optional)               || 7.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Remarks               \n 8.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Item number; Marks and numbers; Number and kind of packages (1); Description of goods                                                 || 9.\u00a0 Gross mass (kg) or other measure (litres, m\u00b3, etc.)                                           || 10.\u00a0 Invoices \u00a0\u00a0 (Optional)                                             \n 11.\u00a0 CUSTOMS ENDORSEMENT \u00a0\u00a0 Declaration certified \u00a0\u00a0 Export document (2) \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Form.................................................. (Signature) ________________________ (*) Insert X in the appropriate box. \nNOTES\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Certificate must not\ncontain erasures or words written over one another. Any alterations must be\nmade by deleting the incorrect particulars and adding any necessary\ncorrections. Any such alteration must be initialled by the person who completed\nthe certificate and endorsed by the Customs authorities of the issuing country\nor territory.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 No spaces must be left\nbetween the items entered on the certificate and each item must be preceded by\nan item number. A horizontal line must be drawn immediately below the last\nitem. Any unused space must be struck through in such a manner as to make any\nlater additions impossible.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Goods must be described in\naccordance with commercial practice and with sufficient detail to enable them\nto be identified.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 APPLICATION FOR A MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE\n 1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Exporter (Name, full address, country) || \u00a0\u00a0 EUR.1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 No A\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 000.000 \n   || See notes overleaf before completing this form. \n   || 2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Application for a certificate to be used in preferential trade between   \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \n 3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Consignee (Name, full address, country) (Optional) || \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 and   \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u00a0 (Insert appropriate countries, groups of countries or territories) \n   || 4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Country, group of countries or territory in which the products are considered as originating     || 5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Country, group of countries or territory of destination       \n 6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Transport details (Optional)               || 7.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Remarks               \n 8.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Item number; Marks and numbers; Number and kind of packages (*); Description of goods                                                             || 9.\u00a0 Gross mass (kg) or other measure (litres, m\u00b3, etc.)                                                       || 10.\u00a0 Invoices \u00a0\u00a0 (Optional)                                                         \n(\u00b9) If goods are not packed, indicate number\nof items or state \u2018in bulk\u2019 as appropriate.\nDECLARATION BY THE EXPORTER\nI, the undersigned, exporter of the goods described overleaf,\n DECLARE || that the goods meet the conditions required for the issue of the attached certificate; \n SPECIFY || as follows the circumstances which have enabled these goods to meet the above conditions: \n   || \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026...\u2026\u2026\u2026 \n   || \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026...\u2026\u2026\u2026 \n   || \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.\u2026.. \n   || \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026... \n SUBMIT || the following supporting documents([67]): \n   || \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026...\u2026 \n   || \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026...\u2026\u2026 \n   || \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026... \n   || \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026... \n UNDERTAKE || to submit, at the request of the appropriate authorities, any supporting evidence which these authorities may require for the purpose of issuing the attached certificate, and undertake, if required, to agree to any inspection of my accounts and to any check on the processes of manufacture of the above goods, carried out by the said authorities; The footnotes do not have to be\nreproduced.\n(1)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 - If only some of the goods listed on the\ninvoice are concerned, they should be clearly indicated or marked and this\nmarking entered on the declaration as follows: \u2018. . . . . . . . . . listed on\nthis invoice and marked . . . . . . . . . . were produced . . . . . . . . . .\u2019.\n- If a document other\nthan an invoice or an annex to the invoice is used (see Article 28(5) of\nthe Protocol), the name of the document concerned should be mentioned instead\nof the word \u2018invoice\u2019.\n(2)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The European Union, a\nMember State of the European Union, a West African State, an OCT or another ACP\nState that has at least provisionally applied an EPA. Where a West African\nState, OCT or another ACP State that has at least provisionally applied an EPA\nis given, a reference must also be made to the European Union customs office\nholding any EUR.1 or EUR.2 certificate(s) concerned, giving the number of the\ncertificate(s) concerned and, if possible, the relevant customs entry number\ninvolved.\n(3)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Place and date.\n(4)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Name and function in\ncompany.\n(5)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Signature.\nANNEX V B \nSupplier\u2019s declaration for products\nnot having preferential original status\n I, the undersigned, declare that the goods listed on this document ................................................ (2) and incorporate the following components or materials which do not have a West African State, other ACP State that has at least provisionally applied an EPA, OCT or European Union origin for preferential trade: \n \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026..................................................................(3) || .......................................................(4) \n ....................................................(5) ||   \n \u2026.......................................................................................................................................................... \n \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.............................................................................................(6) \n I undertake to make available to the customs authorities, if required, evidence in support of this declaration. \n ..............................................................................(7) || ..........................................................................(8) \n ..............................................................................(9) \nNote\nThe above-mentioned text, suitably\ncompleted in conformity with the footnotes below, constitutes a supplier\u2019s\ndeclaration. The footnotes do not have to be reproduced.\n(1)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 - If only some of the goods listed on the\ninvoice are concerned, they should be clearly indicated or marked and this\nmarking entered on the declaration as follows: \u2018. . . . . . . . . . listed on\nthis invoice and marked . . . . . . . . . . were produced . . . . . . . . . .\u2019.\n- If a document other\nthan an invoice or an annex to the invoice is used (see Article 28(5) of\nthe Protocol), the name of the document concerned should be mentioned instead\nof the word \u2018invoice\u2019.\n(2)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The European Union, a\nMember State of the European Union, a West African State, an OCT or another ACP\nState that has at least provisionally applied an EPA.\n(3)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The product description must be given in\nall cases. The description must be adequate and should be sufficiently detailed\nto allow the tariff classification of the goods concerned to be determined.\n(4)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Customs values should be given only if\nrequired.\n(5)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The country of origin should be given only\nif required. The origin to be given must be a preferential origin, all other\norigins should be given as \u2018third country\u2019.\n(6)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Add the following: \u2018and have undergone the\nfollowing processing in [the European Union] [European Union Member State] [West African State] [OCT] [other ACP State that has at least provisionally\napplied an EPA]..............................\u2019, along with a description of the\nprocessing carried out if this information is required.\n(7)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Place and date.\n(8)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Name and function in\ncompany.\n(9)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Signature.\nANNEX VI\nInformation certificate\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The information\ncertificate form given in this Annex shall be used and printed in one or more\nof the official languages in which the Agreement is drawn up and in accordance\nwith the provisions of the domestic law of the exporting State. Information\ncertificates shall be completed in one of those languages; if they are\nhandwritten, they shall be completed in ink in block letters. They shall bear a\nserial number, whether or not printed, by which they can be identified.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The information\ncertificate shall measure 210 x 297 mm (A4 format); a tolerance of up to\nplus 8 mm or minus 5 mm in the length may be allowed. The paper must\nbe white, sized for writing, not contain mechanical pulp and weigh not less\nthan 65 g/m\u00b2.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The national\nadministrations may reserve the right to print the forms themselves or may have\nthem printed by printers approved by them. In the latter case, each certificate\nshall include a reference to such approval. The forms shall bear the name and\naddress of the printer or a mark by which the printer can be identified.\n 1. || Supplier(1)   ||   || INFORMATION CERTIFICATE \n   ||   ||   || to facilitate the issue of a \n   ||   ||   || MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE \n   ||   ||   || for preferential trade between \n 2. || Consignee(1) ||   || THE EUROPEAN UNION and West African State   ||   \n 3. || Processor(1) ||   || 4. However,\nthis provision does not apply to packaging which is not of the normal type for\nthe article packed, and which has a lasting utility value of its own, apart\nfrom its function as packaging.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The value must be indicated in\naccordance with the provisions on rules of origin. \n\n ANNEX VII Form for application for a derogation \n 1. Remarks           ||   \nNOTES\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If the boxes in the form\nare too small for the relevant information, you may attach additional pages to\nthe form. In this case, you should indicate \u2018see annex\u2019 in the box concerned.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If possible, samples or\nother illustrative material (pictures, designs, catalogues, etc.) of the final\nproduct and of the materials should accompany the form.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 You must complete a form\nfor each product covered by the request.\nBoxes 3, 4, 5, 7: \u2018third country\u2019 means any country which is not referred\nto in Article 7.\nBox 12:\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If third country materials have been worked or processed\nin the countries or territories referred to in Article 7 without obtaining\norigin before being further processed in the West African States requesting the\nderogation, you should indicate the working or processing carried out in the\ncountries or territories referred to in Article 7.\nBox 13:\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The dates to be indicated are the initial and final one\nfor the period in which EUR.1 certificates may be issued under the derogation.\nBox 18:\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Indicate either the percentage of added value in respect\nof the ex-works price of the product or the monetary amount of the added value\nper unit of product.\nBox 19:\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If alternative sources of material exist, indicate here\nwhat they are and, if possible, the reasons of cost or other reasons why they\nare not used.\nBox 20:\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Indicate possible further investments or suppliers\u2019\ndifferentiation which make the derogation necessary for only a limited period\nof time.\nANNEX VIII\nOverseas\ncountries and territories\nFor the purposes of this Protocol \u2018overseas\ncountries and territories\u2019 means the countries and territories referred to in\nAnnex II to the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union listed below:\n(This list is without prejudice to the\nstatus of these countries and territories, or future changes in their status.)\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Overseas countries and\nterritories that have special relations with the Kingdom of Denmark:\n\u2013
