Andorra\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Products originating in\nthe Principality of Andorra falling within Chapters 25 to 97 of the Harmonised\nSystem shall be accepted by the West African States as originating in the\nEuropean Union within the meaning of this Agreement. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Protocol defining the\nconcept of \u2018originating products\u2019 and methods of administrative cooperation\nshall apply mutatis mutandis for the purpose of defining the originating\nstatus of the above-mentioned products. \n________ \nJOINT DECLARATION \nconcerning the Republic of San Marino\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Products\noriginating in the Republic of San Marino shall be accepted by the West African\nStates as originating in the European Union within the meaning of this Agreement.\n\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The\nProtocol defining the concept of \u2018originating products\u2019 and methods of\nadministrative cooperation shall apply mutatis mutandis for the purpose\nof defining the originating status of the product.\n[17]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the case of the products composed of materials\nclassified both within headings 3901 to 3906, on the one hand, and within\nheadings 3907 to 3911, on the other hand, this restriction only applies to that\ngroup of materials which predominates by weight in the product.\n[18]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the case of the products composed of materials\nclassified both within headings 3901 to 3906, on the one hand, and within\nheadings 3907 to 3911, on the other hand, this restriction only applies to that\ngroup of materials which predominates by weight in the product.\n[19]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the case of the products composed of materials\nclassified both within headings 3901 to 3906, on the one hand, and within\nheadings 3907 to 3911, on the other hand, this restriction only applies to that\ngroup of materials which predominates by weight in the product.\n[20]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the case of the products composed of materials\nclassified both within headings 3901 to 3906, on the one hand, and within\nheadings 3907 to 3911, on the other hand, this restriction only applies to that\ngroup of materials which predominates by weight in the product.\n[21]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The following foils shall be considered as highly\ntransparent: foils, the optical dimming of which, measured according to ASTM-D\n1003-16 by Gardner Hazemeter (i.e. Hazefactor), is less than 2 %.\n[22]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For special conditions relating to products made of a\nmixture of textile materials, see Introductory Note 5.\n[23]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For special conditions relating to products made of a\nmixture of textile materials, see Introductory Note 5.\n[24]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For special conditions relating to products made of 5.\n[64]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For special conditions relating to products made of a\nmixture of textile materials, see Introductory Note 5.\n[65]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 SEMII \u2013 Semiconductor Equipment and Materials Institute\nIncorporated.\n[66]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For special conditions relating to products made of a\nmixture of textile materials, see Introductory Note 5.\n[67]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For example, import documents, movement certificates,\nmanufacturer's declarations, etc., referring to the products used in\nmanufacture or to the goods re-exported in the same state. \n[68]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where the invoice declaration is made out by an\napproved exporter within the meaning of Article 23 of the Protocol, the\nauthorisation number of the approved exporter must be entered in this space.\nWhere the invoice declaration is not made out by an approved exporter, the\nwords in brackets shall be omitted or the space left blank.\n[69]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Origin of products to be indicated. Where the invoice\ndeclaration relates, in whole or in part, to products originating in Ceuta and Melilla within the meaning of Article 42 of the Protocol, the exporter must\nclearly indicate them in the document on which the declaration is made out by\nmeans of the symbol \u2018CM\u2019.\n[70]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 These indications may be omitted if the information is\ncontained on the document itself.\n[71]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 See Article 22(4) of the Protocol. In cases where\nthe exporter is not required to sign, the exemption of signature also implies\nthe exemption of the name of the signatory.\nANNEX B\nCUSTOMS DUTIES ON PRODUCTS ORIGINATING IN WEST AFRICA\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Without prejudice to\nparagraphs 2, 3 and 4, customs duties on imports imposed by the European Union\nParty (hereinafter 'European Union customs duties') shall be entirely\neliminated on all products, originating in the West Africa Party, in Chapters 1\nto 97 of the HS, except those in Chapter 93 thereof, upon the entry into force\nof this Agreement. For products in Chapter 93, the European Union Party shall\ncontinue to apply the Most Favoured Nation (MFN) duties.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 a)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The European Union\nParty may, during the period between the entry into force of this Agreement and\n30 September 2015, impose the applied MFN duty on the products originating in\nthe West Africa Party of tariff heading 17.01 imported in excess of the\nfollowing levels expressed in white sugar equivalent, which are deemed to cause\na disruption in the European Union Party sugar market:\ni)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 3,5 million tonnes in a marketing\nyear for products originating in the members of the African, Caribbean and\nPacific Group of States (ACP States) signatory to the Cotonou Agreement, and\nii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 1,6 million tonnes in marketing year\n2014/2015 for products originating in the ACP States which are not recognised\nby the United Nations as Least Developed Countries. \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The import of products of tariff\nheading 17.01 originating in any signatory West African State which is recognised\nby the United Nations as a Least Developed Country shall not be subject to the\nprovisions of subparagraph (a). However, such imports shall remain subject to\nthe provisions of Article 22[1].\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The imposition of the applied MFN duty\nshall cease at the end of the marketing year during which it was introduced;\nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Any measure taken pursuant to this\nparagraph shall be notified immediately to the Joint Implementation Committee of\nthe EPA and shall be the subject of periodic consultations within that body.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 As of 1 October 2015, for\nthe purpose of applying the provisions of Article 22, disruptions in the market\nfor products of tariff heading 17.01 may be deemed to arise in situations where\nthe average European Community price of white sugar falls during two\nconsecutive months below 80 % of the average European Community price for white\nsugar prevailing during the previous marketing year.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 From the entry into force\nof this Agreement until 30 September 2015, products of tariff headings 1704.90.99,\n1806.10.30, 1806.10.90, 2106.90.59 and 2106.90.98 shall be subject to a special\nsurveillance mechanism in order to ensure that the arrangements provided for in\nparagraph 2 are not being circumvented. In the event of a cumulative increase\nin imports of one or more of these products originating in the West Africa\nParty by more than 20 % in volume during a period of twelve (12)\nconsecutive months compared with the average of the yearly imports over the\nthree (3) previous twelve (12) month periods, the European Union Party shall\nanalyse the pattern of trade, the economic justification and the sugar content\nof such imports and, if it concludes that such imports are used to circumvent\nthe arrangements provided for in paragraph 2, it may suspend the preferential\ntreatment and introduce the specific MFN duties applied to imports pursuant to\nthe European Union Common Customs Tariff for products under tariff headings 1704.90.99,\n1806.10.30, 1806.10.90, 2106.90.59 and 2106.90.98 originating in the West\nAfrica Party. Subparagraphs 2(b), (c) and (d) shall apply mutatis mutandis\nto action under this paragraph.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Paragraph 1 shall not\napply to products of tariff heading 0803.00.19 originating in West Africa and\nreleased for free circulation in the outermost regions of the European Union\nParty. Paragraph 1 shall not apply to products of tariff heading 17.01\noriginating in West Africa and released for free circulation in the French\nOverseas Departments. This provision shall be applicable for a period of ten\n(10) years. This period shall be extended for a further ten (10) years unless\nthe Parties agree otherwise.\n[1]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For\nthese purposes and by derogation from Article 22, individual West African\nStates recognised by the United Nations as Least Developed Countries may be\nsubject to safeguard measures.\nANNEX C\n(Part 1)\nCUSTOMS DUTIES ON PRODUCTS ORIGINATING IN THE EUROPEAN\n UNION\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In accordance with Article\n10 of the Agreement, West Africa shall liberalise some products originating in\nthe European Union Party imported into its territory according to the tariff dismantling\ncategories A, B and C. A fourth category, D, covers the list of sensitive\nproducts for the region, which are excluded from liberalisation.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The classification of products into the various\nliberalisation groups essentially follows the categorisation of products in the\ntariff bands of the ECOWAS Common External Tariff (ECOWAS CET). Consequently:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 group A covers essential social goods,\nbasic necessities, basic commodities, capital goods and specific inputs;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 group B includes mainly inputs and\nintermediate goods; and\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 group C covers mainly final\nconsumption goods. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Tariff dismantling is\ndesigned in such a way that the progressive reduction in duties is in line with\nthe structure of the ECOWAS CET tariff bands for intermediate cuts. Tariffs on\nproducts to be liberalised shall be eliminated every five (5) years, at the end\nof each five-year period with effect from the first day of the following year.\nLiberalisation shall take place over a period of twenty (20) years from year T,\nwhich is the year that the Agreement enters into force, in accordance with\nArticle 107.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A modulation shall, however,\nbe introduced into this schedule for group A products already taxed at 0 per\ncent in the CET. These products shall be deemed to be liberalised as of the\nfirst year in which the Agreement enters into force. The other products in\ngroup A, group B and group C shall be liberalised progressively at the end of\neach of the four five-year periods following the entry into force of the\nAgreement. However, group B products taxed at 0 per cent shall be deemed to be\nliberalised as soon as the group is liberalised. \n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The tariff dismantling\nschedule shall be as follows:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For group A products, tariff dismantling\nshall take place in two phases:\ni)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 when the Agreement enters into force,\n West Africa shall liberalise 73 tariff lines:\nii)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 on 1 January T+5, the other tariff\nlines shall be liberalised.\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For Group B products, liberalisation\nshall take place between 1 January T+5 and 1 January T+15, i.e. over a period\nof ten (10) years;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For Group C products, liberalisation\nshall take place between 1 January T+5 and 1 January T+20, i.e. over a period\nof fifteen (15) years;\nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Group D products shall be excluded\nfrom liberalisation.\n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The liberalisation\nschedule is summarised in the following table:\nSummary of tariff dismantling by five-year period and liberalisation\ngroup\n GROUPS || Basic duties || T || 1/01/T+5 || 1/01/T+10 || 1/01/T+15 || 1/01/T+20 \n Group D || 0 ||   Exclusion \n 10 \n 20 \n 35 \n Group C || 5 || -0% || -0 % || -100 % || -100 % || -100 % \n 10 || -0 % || -0 % || -50 % || -100 % || -100 % \n 20 || -0 % || -0 % || -50 % || -75 % || -100 % \n Group B || 0 || -0 % || -100 % || -100% || -100 % || -100 % \n 5 || -0 % || -0 % || -100 % || -100 % || -100 % \n 10 || -0 % || -0 % || -50 % || -100 % || -100 % \n Group A || 0 || -100 % || -100 % || -100 % || -100 % || -100 % \n 5 || -0 % || -100 % || -100 % || -100 % || -100 % \nANNEX C (Part 2)\nTariff\ndismantlement calendar of the countries of the West African Region\n Heading PHYTOSANITARY MEASURES\nAppendix I\nList\nof priority products from the West Africa Party for export to the European\nUnion\nThese products shall be identified by the\nWest Africa Party and notified to the Joint Implementation Committee of the EPA\nat the latest three (3) months from the date of its establishment. \nAppendix II\nList\nof competent authorities\nA. List of competent European Union\nauthorities\nResponsibility for monitoring activities\nshall be shared between the national services of the Member States and the\nEuropean Commission. The following provisions shall apply on this subject:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 as regards exports to the West\nAfrican region, the Member States shall be responsible for monitoring\nproduction conditions and requirements, in particular the performance of the\ncompulsory inspections and the issuing of health (or animal welfare)\ncertificates confirming compliance with the agreed standards and requirements;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 as regards imports from the West\nAfrican region, the Member States shall be responsible for monitoring\ncompliance with the import conditions set by the European Union;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the European Commission shall be\nresponsible for the general coordination, inspection and auditing of the\nmonitoring systems, and for taking the legislative initiatives required to\nensure the uniform application of standards and requirements on the European\ninternal market. \nThese authorities shall be appointed by the\nEuropean Union Party and notified to the Joint Implementation Committee of the EPA\nat the latest three (3) months from the date of its establishment. \nB. List of competent authorities of the\nWest African region\nThese authorities shall be appointed by the\nWest Africa Party and notified to the Joint Implementation Committee of the EPA\nat the latest three (3) months from the date of its establishment. \nANNEX E\nPROTOCOL ON MUTUAL ADMINISTRATIVE\nASSISTANCE IN CUSTOMS MATTERS\nArticle 1\nDefinitions\nFor the\npurposes of this Protocol: \na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018customs legislation\u2019 means any\nlegal or regulatory provisions applicable in the territories of the Parties,\ngoverning the import, export and transit of goods and their placing under any\nother customs regime or procedure, including measures of prohibition,\nrestriction and control;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018applicant authority\u2019 means a\ncompetent administrative authority which has been designated by the Parties for\nthis purpose and which makes a request for assistance on the basis of this\nProtocol;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018requested authority\u2019 means a\ncompetent administrative authority which has been designated by the Parties for\nthis purpose and which receives a request for assistance on the basis of this\nProtocol;\nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018personal data\u2019 means all\ninformation relating to an identified or identifiable individual;\ne)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018operation in breach of customs\nlegislation\u2019 means any violation or attempted violation of customs legislation;\nf)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018information\u2019 means any data,\nwhether or not processed or analysed, and documents, reports and other\ncommunications in any format, including electronic, or certified or\nauthenticated copies thereof.\nArticle 2\nScope\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Parties shall assist\neach other, in the areas within their competence, in the manner and under the\nconditions laid down in this Protocol, to ensure the correct application of the\ncustoms legislation, in particular by preventing, investigating and combating\noperations in breach of that legislation.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Assistance in customs\nmatters, as provided for in this Protocol, shall apply to any administrative\nauthority of the Parties which is competent for the application of this\nProtocol. It shall not prejudice the rules governing mutual assistance in\ncriminal matters. Nor shall it cover information obtained under powers\nexercised at the request of a judicial authority, except where communication of\nsuch information is authorised by that authority.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Assistance to recover duties, taxes or fines is not covered by this\nProtocol.\nArticle 3\nAssistance on request\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 At the request of the\napplicant authority, the requested authority shall provide it with all relevant\ninformation which may enable it to ensure that customs legislation, including\nprovisions on customs value and origin of goods, is correctly applied. This\nwill also include information regarding activities noted or planned which are,\nor could be, operations in breach of customs legislation.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 At the request of the applicant authority, the requested authority\nshall inform it:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 whether goods exported from the\nterritory of one of the Parties have been properly imported into the territory\nof the other Party, specifying, where appropriate, the customs procedure\napplied to the goods;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 whether goods imported into the\nterritory of one of the Parties have been properly exported from the territory\nof the other Party, specifying, where appropriate, the customs procedure\napplied to the goods;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 whether the official documents\npresented in support of a declaration of goods on the customs territory of the\napplicant authority are authentic.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 At the request of the\napplicant authority, the requested authority shall, within the framework of its\nlegal or regulatory provisions, take the necessary steps to ensure special\nsurveillance of:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 natural or legal persons in respect of\nwhom there are reasonable grounds for believing that they are or have been\ninvolved in operations in breach of customs legislation;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 places where stocks of goods have been\nor may be assembled in such a way that there are reasonable grounds for\nbelieving that these goods are intended to be used in operations in breach of\ncustoms legislation;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 goods that are or may be transported\nin such a way that there are reasonable grounds for believing that they are\nintended to be used in operations in breach of customs legislation; and\nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 means of transport that are or may be\nused in such a way that there are reasonable grounds for believing that they\nare intended to be used in operations in breach of customs legislation.\nArticle 4\nSpontaneous assistance\nThe Parties shall assist each other, at\ntheir own initiative and in accordance with their legal or regulatory\nprovisions, if they consider that to be necessary for the correct application\nof customs legislation, particularly by providing information obtained\npertaining to:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 operations which are or appear to\nbe in breach of customs legislation and which may be of interest to the other\nParty;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 new means or methods employed in\ncarrying out operations in breach of customs legislation;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 goods known to be subject to\noperations in breach of customs legislation;\nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 natural or legal persons in\nrespect of whom there are reasonable grounds for believing that they are or\nhave been involved in operations in breach of customs legislation, and\ne)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 means of transport in respect of\nwhich there are reasonable grounds for believing that they have been, are, or\nmay be used in operations in breach of customs legislation.\nArticle 5\nDelivery and notification\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 At\nthe request of the applicant authority, the requested\nauthority shall, in accordance with legal or regulatory provisions applicable\nto the latter, take all necessary measures in order:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 to deliver any documents, or\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 to notify any decisions,\nemanating from the applicant authority and\nfalling within the scope of this Protocol, to an addressee residing or\nestablished in the territory of the requested authority.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Requests for delivery of\ndocuments or notification of decisions shall be made in writing in an official\nlanguage of the requested authority or in a language acceptable to that\nauthority. In such a case Article 6(3) is applicable.\nArticle 6\nForm and substance of requests for assistance\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Requests pursuant to this\nProtocol shall be made in writing. They shall be accompanied by the documents\nnecessary to enable compliance with the request. When required because of the\nurgency of the situation, oral requests may be accepted, but must be confirmed\nin writing immediately.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Requests\npursuant to paragraph 1 shall include the following information:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the applicant authority;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the measure requested;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the object of and the reason for the\nrequest;\nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the legal or regulatory provisions and\nother legal elements involved;\ne)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 indications as exact and comprehensive\nas possible on the natural or legal persons who are the target of the\ninvestigations; and \nf)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 a summary of the relevant facts and\nof the enquiries already carried out.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Requests\nshall be submitted in English, French, Portuguese or any other language\nacceptable to the requested authority. Any accompanying documents shall be\ntranslated, if necessary, into a mutually acceptable language.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If a request does not meet\nthe formal requirements set out above, its correction or completion may be\nrequested; in the meantime precautionary measures may be ordered.\nArticle 7\nExecution of requests\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In order to comply with a\nrequest for assistance, the requested authority shall proceed, within the\nlimits of its competence and available resources, as though it were acting on\nits own account or at the request of other authorities of that same Party, by\nsupplying information already possessed, by carrying out appropriate enquiries\nor by arranging for them to be carried out. This provision shall also apply to\nany other authority to which the request has been addressed by the requested\nauthority when the latter cannot act on its own.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Requests for assistance\nshall be executed in accordance with the legal or regulatory provisions of the\nrequested Party.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Duly authorised officials\nof a Party may, with the agreement of the requested Party involved and subject\nto the conditions laid down by the latter, be present to obtain, in the offices\nof the requested authority or any other authority concerned in accordance with\nparagraph 1, information relating to activities that are or may be operations\nin breach of customs legislation which the applicant authority needs for the\npurposes of this Protocol.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Duly authorised officials\nof the applicant Party involved may, with the agreement of the requested Party\ninvolved and subject to the conditions laid down by the latter, be present at\nenquiries carried out in the latter's territory.\nArticle 8\nForm in which information is to be communicated\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The requested authority\nshall communicate the results of enquiries to the applicant authority in\nwriting together with relevant documents, certified copies or other items.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 This information may be in\ncomputerised form.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Original documents shall\nbe transmitted only upon request in cases where certified copies would be\ninsufficient. These originals shall be returned at the earliest opportunity or\nat the request of the competent authority which has provided them.\nArticle 9\nExceptions to the obligation to provide assistance\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Assistance may be refused\nor may be subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions or requirements, in\ncases where the West Africa Party or the European Union Party is of the opinion\nthat assistance under this Protocol would:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 be likely to prejudice the sovereignty\nof the West African State or of the Member State of the European Union which\nhas been requested to provide assistance under this Protocol; or\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 be likely to prejudice public policy,\nsecurity or other essential interests, in particular in the cases referred to\nunder Article 10(2); or\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 be likely to violate an industrial,\ncommercial or professional secret.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Assistance may be\npostponed by the requested authority on the ground that it would interfere with\nan ongoing investigation, prosecution or proceeding. In such a case, the\nrequested authority shall consult with the applicant authority to determine if\nassistance can be given subject to such terms or conditions as the requested\nauthority may require.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where the applicant\nauthority seeks assistance which it would itself be unable to provide if so\nrequested, it shall draw attention to that fact in its request. It shall then\nbe for the requested authority to decide how to respond to such a request.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If the requested authority\nconsiders that the effort required to fulfil a request is clearly\ndisproportionate to the perceived benefit to the applicant authority, it may\ndecline to provide the requested assistance.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the cases referred to\nin paragraphs 1, 2, and 4 the decision of the requested authority and the\nreasons therefor must be communicated to the applicant authority without delay.\nArticle 10\nInformation exchange and confidentiality\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Any information\ncommunicated in whatsoever form pursuant to this Protocol shall be of a\nconfidential or restricted nature, depending on the rules applicable in each of\nthe Parties. It shall be covered by the obligation of official secrecy and\nshall enjoy the protection extended to similar information under the relevant\nlegal provisions of the Party that received it.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Personal data may be\nexchanged only if the receiving Party undertakes to protect the data in a way\nat least equivalent to that applicable to the particular case in the Party\nsupplying the data. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The use, in judicial or\nadministrative proceedings instituted in respect of operations in breach of\ncustoms legislation, of information obtained under this Protocol, is considered\nto be for the purposes of this Protocol. Therefore, the Parties may, in their\nrecords of evidence, reports and testimonies and in proceedings and charges\nbrought before the courts, use as evidence information obtained and documents\nconsulted in accordance with the provisions of this Protocol. The competent\nauthority which supplied that information or gave access to those documents\nshall be notified of such use.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Information obtained shall\nbe used solely for the purposes of this Protocol. Where one of the Parties\nwishes to use such information for other purposes, it shall obtain the prior\nwritten consent of the authority which provided the information. Such use shall\nthen be subject to any restrictions laid down by that authority.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 On request, the applicant\nauthority receiving personal data shall inform the requested authority which\nsupplied the data of the use made of it and the results achieved.\n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Personal data supplied\nunder this Protocol shall be kept only for the time necessary to achieve the\npurpose for which it was supplied.\n7.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The requested authority\nsupplying personal data shall, to the extent possible, ensure that this data\nhas been collected fairly and lawfully and that it is accurate and up to date\nand not excessive in relation to the purposes for which it is supplied.\nArticle 11\nExperts and witnesses\nAn official of\na requested authority may be authorised to appear, within the limitations of\nthe authorisation granted, as an expert or witness in judicial or\nadministrative proceedings regarding the matters covered by this Protocol, and\nproduce such objects, documents or certified copies thereof as may be needed\nfor the proceedings. The request for appearance must indicate specifically\nbefore which judicial or administrative authority the official will have to\nappear, on what matters and by virtue of what title or qualification the\nofficial will be questioned.\nArticle 12\nAssistance expenses\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Parties shall waive\nall claims on each other for the reimbursement of expenses incurred in the\napplication of this Protocol, except, as appropriate, for expenses to experts\nand witnesses, and those to interpreters and translators who are not public\nservice employees. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Without prejudice to the\nprovisions of paragraph 1 and Article 7(1), if the execution of a request\nrequires justified expenses of an extraordinary nature, the Parties shall\nconsult each other to determine the terms and conditions under which the\nrequest will be executed, including the manner in which the costs shall be\nborne.\u00a0 \nArticle 13\nImplementation\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The implementation of this\nProtocol shall be entrusted on the one hand to the customs authorities of the\nWest African States and on the other hand to the competent services of the\nEuropean Commission and, if necessary, the customs authorities of the Member\nStates of the European Union. They shall decide on all practical measures and\narrangements necessary for its application, taking into consideration the rules\nin force in particular in the field of data protection. They may recommend to\nthe competent bodies amendments which they consider should be made to this\nProtocol.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Parties shall consult\neach other and subsequently keep each other informed of the detailed rules of\nimplementation which are adopted in accordance with the provisions of this\nProtocol.\nArticle 14\nOther agreements\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Taking into account the respective\ncompetences of the European Union and its Member States, on the one hand, and\nof ECOWAS, the UEMOA and the West African States, on the other hand, the\nprovisions of this Protocol shall:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 not affect the obligations of the\nParties under any other international agreement or convention;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 be deemed complementary to agreements\non mutual assistance which have been or may be concluded between individual Member States of the European Union and the West African States, and shall \nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 not affect the European Union\u2019s\nprovisions governing the communication between the competent services of the\nEuropean Commission and the customs authorities of the Member States of any\ninformation obtained under this Protocol which could be of interest to the\nEuropean Union; \nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 not affect the relevant provisions of\nthe West Africa Party governing the communication between the competent\nservices of the ECOWAS Commission or the UEMOA and the customs authorities of\ntheir Member States of any information obtained under this Protocol which could\nbe of interest to the West Africa Party.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Notwithstanding the\nprovisions of paragraph 1, the provisions of this Protocol shall take\nprecedence over the provisions of any bilateral agreement on mutual assistance\nwhich has been or may be concluded between individual Member States of the European Union and a West African State insofar as the provisions of the latter\nare incompatible with those of this Protocol.\nArticle 15\nApplication\nIn respect of\nquestions relating to the application of this Protocol and any of its\nprovisions the Parties shall consult each other to resolve the matter in the\nframework of the Special Committee on Customs and Trade Facilitation set up\nunder Article 45 of Chapter 5 of this Agreement.\nANNEX F\nPROTOCOL ON THE EPA DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME (PAPED)\nPREAMBLE\nTHE PARTIES TO THE ECONOMIC PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE WEST AFRICAN STATES, ECOWAS AND THE UEMOA, OF THE ONE PART, AND THE EUROPEAN UNION AND ITS MEMBER STATES, OF THE OTHER PART\nBEARING IN MIND the objectives set out in\nthe EPA;\nCONVINCED of the need to make the EPA\nDevelopment Programme (PAPED) one of the main instruments for ensuring the\ndevelopment dimension of the EPA between West Africa and the European Union;\nTaking\nnote of the conclusions of the Council of the European\nUnion of 10 May 2010 and 17 March 2014, which welcomed PAPED and\nacknowledged the importance of mechanisms to help the West African region to\naddress adaptation and adjustment needs in the economic, social and taxation\nfields, and estimates of the indicative funds available at those dates for\nactivities connected to PAPED under all its financial instruments; \nWISHING to specify the arrangements for\nimplementing and supporting PAPED by way of agreement, by means of an annex\nforming an integral part of the EPA and in accordance with its principles;\nHAVE AGREED AS\nFOLLOWS:\nCHAPTER\nI - OBJECTIVES AND PRINCIPLES\nArticle 1\nObjectives\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The objective of this\nProtocol is to specify the implementation arrangements for the EPA Development\nProgramme (PAPED) on the basis of the provisions of part III of the Agreement.\nThis implementation shall be carried out in a spirit of partnership, in the\ncontext of support for the West African region's efforts to meet the objectives\ndefined in the Economic Partnership Agreement and the Cotonou Agreement. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In accordance with the\nprovisions of Article 57 of the Agreement, the implementation of PAPED\nshall promote:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 diversification and growth of\nproduction capacities;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 development of intra-regional trade\nand facilitation of access to international markets;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 improvement and reinforcement of\nregional and national trade-related infrastructure; \nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 implementation of the necessary\nadjustments and consideration of other trade-related needs;\ne)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 implementation and\nmonitoring/evaluation of the EPA by the West African region.\nArticle 2\nPrinciples\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Parties undertake to\napply this Protocol while taking into account internationally-agreed\ncommitments on the effectiveness of development aid, and the development\nobjectives, strategies and priorities of the West African region at both\nnational and regional level. In particular, the vulnerability of landlocked and\nisland countries and the specific needs of post-conflict countries shall be\ntaken into account.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the context of pursuit\nof the objectives of the EPA and the application of this Protocol, the Parties\nshall affirm and adhere to the following principles:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 alignment between stated needs and\nfunding; \nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 aid ownership and predictability in\nthe sense of the Paris Declaration on Aid Effectiveness and the Accra Agenda\nfor Action;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sustainability of resources within the\nmeaning of Article 2(3) of the Agreement;\nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 effectiveness, consistency and\ncoordination of actions;\ne)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 subsidiarity between regional and\nnational level;\nf)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 multi-annual\nprogramming of activities covered by PAPED.\nCHAPTER\nII - ARRANGEMENTS FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF PAPED\nArticle 3 \nProgramming\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 PAPED shall be implemented\non the indicative basis of a matrix of activities broken down into operational\nplans specifying the priority activities of the West African region at national\nand regional level, their estimated costs and their schedule for\nimplementation. The operational plans shall be established through a\nparticipatory process and in consultation with the technical and financial\npartners for each implementation period, on the basis of the PAPED framework\ndocument.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In application of Article 54\nof the Agreement, the programming of European Union assistance shall be carried\nout for the European Development Fund (EDF) in accordance with the provisions\nof the Cotonou Agreement and national and regional indicative programmes. The\nprogramming of assistance provided by the European Union Member States shall be\ncarried out in accordance with the provisions of their respective bilateral\ncooperation instruments. For other instruments, programming shall be carried\nout in accordance with their respective legal bases.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The operational plans\nshall be sufficiently flexible to ensure that the activities are kept\nconstantly in line with PAPED objectives and to take account of any changes\noccurring in the circumstances of States and regional organisations. To that\nend, the two Parties shall, inter alia, carry out a periodic review of these\nplans.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The Parties shall agree to\nseek synergies and complementarities between PAPED activities and other\nprogrammes to support trade during the drafting, implementation, monitoring and\nevaluation phases, including in the implementation of the working arrangement.\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the context of the\nprocedures referred to in Article 54 of the Agreement, the Parties shall\nagree on the indicative funding plans relating to the operational plans\nfollowing a dialogue involving the other technical and financial partners, the\nconclusions of which shall be jointly agreed and signed by the West Africa and\nthe European Union Parties. \n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The\n West Africa Party shall undertake to ensure consistency between the\nimplementation of PAPED of the one part, and its economic and sectoral\ndevelopment policies and strategies and budget planning instruments of the\nother part. \nCHAPTER\nIII - FUNDING ARRANGEMENTS\nArticle 4\nSources of funding\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The\narrangements for funding from the European Union and its Member States are described in Article 54 of the Agreement.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The\nWest Africa Party shall contribute, including financially, to the\nimplementation of PAPED.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In\nthe context of the cooperation referred to in Article 54(4) of the\nAgreement, the European Union and its Member States shall provide support in\nseeking the necessary additional funding, in particular by facilitating the\ninvolvement of other donors.\nArticle 5\nAmount of funding\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In\nthe framework of Articles 3 and 4 of this Protocol and part III of the\nAgreement, the Parties shall undertake to mobilise resources to fund\nmulti-annual operational plans.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The\nindicative amount of funding to be provided by the European Union Party for\neach multi-annual plan shall be notified to the West Africa Party at the\nbeginning of the period, subject to the duration of the programming cycles of\nthe cooperation instruments employed to that effect, in accordance with Article 3(5)\nof this Protocol. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Before\nthe end of each period of implementation of the operational plans, the Parties\nshall evaluate the state of implementation of the programmes, the extent to\nwhich the commitments have been achieved, and the level of disbursements. This\njoint evaluation shall serve as the basis for the operational plans for the\nnext period.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The\nJoint Council of the West Africa-European Union EPA shall consider any matter\nrelating to developmental aspects of the Agreement and make appropriate\nrecommendations for its effective implementation.\nArticle 6\nEligibility for funding\nThe bodies and organisations eligible for\nfunding set up under PAPED, subject to the provisions of the specific\ncooperation instruments mobilised to that effect, shall include, but shall not\nbe limited to, the following, namely:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 West African States and their subdivisions;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Regional integration\norganisations (ECOWAS, UEMOA) and their specialised structures;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Other inter-governmental\norganisations to which one or more West African States belong, including\norganisations containing West African non-member states, which have been\napproved by the West African States or by both regional organisations;\nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Joint bodies set up by the West\nAfrican States and the European Union to achieve certain specific objectives;\ne)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 National and/or regional public\nor semi-public agencies, financial institutions and development banks of the\nWest African States; Companies, firms and other private sector bodies of the\nWest African States or West African region;\nf)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 West African financial\nintermediaries which grant, promote and finance private investment in the West\nAfrican States;\ng)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Non-state actors of the West\nAfrican States.\nArticle 7\nEPA\nregional fund\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In\naccordance with the provisions of Article 61 of the Agreement, the West\nAfrica Party, in consultation with the technical and financial partners, shall\nestablish an EPA regional fund in order to mobilise, channel and coordinate the\nresources of the European Union, West Africa and other donors in connection\nwith PAPED. The EPA regional fund's areas of intervention are those covered by\nPAPED. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Notwithstanding\nthe provisions of paragraph 1 of this Article, the Parties may agree on any\nother mechanism or arrangement to finance PAPED. Where appropriate, the Parties\nshall establish procedures in line with the Paris Declaration on Aid\nEffectiveness in order to ensure the simplified, effective and timely\nimplementation of assistance.\nCHAPTER IV \nWORKING ARRANGEMENT\nArticle 8\nWorking arrangement\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Taking\naccount of its commitments on aid effectiveness, and in the context of its\nsupport for PAPED, the European Union Party shall put in place its own working\narrangement, consistent with the institutional set-up of the EPA, aimed at\nensuring, inter alia, the following functions:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 coordination of European support, in\naccordance with the European Union Code of Conduct on Division of Labour in\nDevelopment Policy;\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 monitoring of the assistance provided;\nc)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 dialogue with stakeholders on the\nimplementation of PAPED and the relevant economic and sectoral development\npolicies and strategies;\nd)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 mobilisation of resources, in accordance\nwith Article 54 of the Agreement; \ne)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 balance and alignment of needs,\nsupport and funding sources.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The\nWest Africa Party shall put in place its own working arrangement, consistent\nwith the institutional set-up of the EPA, aimed at ensuring that PAPED\nactivities are implemented in synergy with the regional integration agenda, in\nparticular the implementation of regional policies by the States and the\napplication of the regional regulatory framework and its monitoring.\nCHAPTER V - FINAL PROVISIONS\nArticle 9\nEvaluation\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The\nParties shall ensure that PAPED is evaluated at agreed intervals. The strategic\nframework of PAPED, its matrix of activities and its operational plans are the\nbasic elements for this evaluation.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In\nthe framework of the Competitiveness Observatory provided for in Article 61\nof the Agreement, the Parties shall jointly define the output and result\nindicators, in particular regarding the effects and impact of the EPA and PAPED\nin the West African region on, inter alia, competitiveness and\ndiversification of production, investments, regional trade, trade with the\nEuropean Union and the rest of the world, particularly exports of processed\nproducts and services from the West Africa Party, employment and, more\ngenerally, the economic and social development of the West African States.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Under\nthe provisions of part III of the Agreement, the Parties shall use the jointly\ndefined indicators to seek synergy between the pace of implementation of the\ncommitments made by the West Africa Party on the one hand, and the progress in\nimplementing PAPED activities and programmes on the other.\nArticle 10\nReview of the Protocol\nAmendments and\nrevisions to this Protocol shall be subject to the same rules and procedures as\nthose provided for in Article 111 of the Agreement.\nANNEX\nto the\nProposal for a Council Decision\non the signing and provisional\napplication of the Economic Partnership Agreement (EPA) between the West\nAfrican States, ECOWAS and the UEMOA, of the one part, and the European Union\nand its Member States, of the other part\nJOINT\nDECLARATION REGARDING COUNTRIES WHICH HAVE ESTABLISHED A CUSTOMS UNION WITH THE\nEUROPEAN UNION\nThe European Union Party underlines the\nobligation for countries which have established a customs union with the\nEuropean Union to align their trade regime with that of the European Union and,\nfor some of them, to conclude preferential agreements with the countries that\nhave preferential agreements with the European Union. \nIn this context, the European Union calls\nupon the West Africa Party to enter negotiations as soon as possible with the\ncountries which:\na)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 have established a customs union\nwith the European Union and\nb)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 whose products are not covered by\nthe tariff conditions provided for by this Agreement,\nwith the aim of concluding a bilateral\nagreement establishing a free-trade area. \nThe West Africa Party takes note and\ninforms the European Union Party that it will do everything to ensure that the\nEuropean Union's request regarding the negotiation of free-trade agreements\nwith the countries concerned will be appropriately examined.\nANNEX C\n(Part 10)\n Heading HS2012 || Tariff and Statistical Nomenclature ||
